div.head: PRELUDE. ---
div.stage: A STORM at SEA.-- A ship on the horizon founders and breaks up.-- As ship disappears beneath the waves a girl is seen clinging to a floating chicken-coop.-- This coop also contains a mule and a chicken. It drifts across stage and disappears, in wings. ---

div.head: ACT I.
SCENE 1.--THE ROSE KINGDOM.--
div.stage: Stage set to represent a huge hothouse, with dome roof and sides representing panes of glass. The background is gauze, with a supplementary setting of "The Royal Gardens" behind it.--AT RISE, no lights back of gauze, front lights making the background appear opaque.--In foreground, groups of girls are discovered dressed to represent Roses, surrounding BETSY BAKER who is sitting down with the chicken on her shoulder and Mule by her side. ---

div.head: OPENING CHORUS:

lg.l: You have filled us with confusion--
An action most ungracious in a mortal such as you!
And you really must be going
For to interfere with roses is a careless thing to do.
But I've just been badly wrecked
A little hospitality in such a bow'r of beauty,
But I'll tell you what's the matter:
There are thorns in all your chatter,
And some day you will be reproached for laxness in your duty.
By expert horticulturists to be exceeding rare,
Is at once upon its nettle,
And every bud and blossom is as dangerous as fair.
Hey dey! That is to say,
You're pretty to look at but horrid to Strangers!
Heigh ho! Where shall we go?
Wherever we wander we run into dangers.

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

lg.l: There's no one to love us or comfort us, dear.

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

lg.l: Would turn us away when we want to stay here?
You are very pert and saucy!
And inclined to be quite bossy,
But we'll not submit to impudence from any mortal maid!
Spite of all your bluff and braying
You have no excuse for staying
This hot-house is too warm for you we're very much afraid.
Roses, you are on the scent!
Though so dainty now you look,
In claiming hospitality where none is offered you:
We must still insist on saying
That our laws we are obeying
By forcing you to leave us and to bid our land adieu.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I'm not welcome here, I guess!

sp.speaker: MOSS ROSE:
sp.p: Why did you come?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Couldn't help it, my dears. A little while ago I was all at sea, but the ship broke up in business and I became a floater. I stranged on your shore, outside, and here I am---me and dear old Hank and Baden-Baden.

sp.speaker: TEA ROSE:
sp.p: Who are Hank and Baden-Baden?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Hank's my mule---faithful and true; ain't you Hank?

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

sp.speaker: CHORUS:
sp.p: How dreadful!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Only at first. When you get used to it, it puts you to sleep.

sp.speaker: MOSS ROSE:
sp.p: And who is Baden-Baden?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: My spring chicken. You can't see the springs: they're inside.

sp.speaker: JACQUE ROSE:
sp.p: Are the springs the most important part of Baden-Baden?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Oh, no. The most important thing is the Casino.

sp.speaker: TEA ROSE:
sp.p: Why don't you call her Casino?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Don't want to make game of her. She's an innocent pullet just new. When she gets older she'll be a pusher! But say, Roses, are we invited to your party, or not? Usually ship-wrecked people are joyfully received wherever they land. It's considered lucky, you know.

sp.speaker: MOSS ROSE
sp.p: For whom?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: For those ship-wrecked.

sp.speaker: MOSS ROSE:
sp.p: Inn't lucky for us. This is our own especial hot-house and only Roses are allowed here.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Some of you are pretty loud, that's true. (Turns to mule)
Hank, are we roses?

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw! (Chicken flaps wings)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: He says we are. Hank's a full-blown Jacque Rose. Even his tail's bushy.

sp.speaker: JACQUE ROSE:
sp.p: He's a jack; we can see that. But you must go away to some other place. We cannot entertain you.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Very well, I'll cut you dead. Then you'll be cut roses----- thirty cents a dozen in the Bargain Basement.

sp.speaker: TEA ROSE:
sp.p: We are perfectly fresh.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: You look it.

sp.speaker: MOSS ROSE:
sp.p: And of excellent variety.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Then you ought to go into vaudeville. "Those roses that bloom in the spring, tra, la!" You could do all right, you know.

sp.speaker: JACQUE ROSE:
sp.p: Cease this chatter, and leave us to ourselves.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Don't you need a gardener?

sp.speaker: MOSS ROSE:
sp.p: We have one, who is responsible for our culture and beauty.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Then he's a wonder. Where is he?

sp.speaker: GARDENER
sp.p: Here I am!

div.stage: (Hank makes a dive at the GARDENER, who runs and makes hasty EXIT. A crash of glass is heard and the SHAGGY MAN falls through a sash at L. ROSES all draw back startled and EXIT. SHAGGY MAN is eating an apple as he comes to sitting position on stage. BETSY, with Baden-Baden on her shoulder, and HANK, approach him and look at him curiously. He continues to eat his apple and pays no attention to his surroundings. Around his waist are fragments of the sash. BETSY tries to lift it off.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Good gracious! Where did you come from?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: From outside. Don't untie my sash. It makes me feel dressed up. Ah, this is a pane-ful experience. I climbed an apple-tree over yonder and the branch gave way. I took a drop too much, and here I am. For the first time in my life I might be accused of being a second- story man.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: You're in good company, then. Lots of these Roses are porch- climbers. Say, gimme an apple!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Wait a minute and see if there's a core. Apples aren't good for little girls. They've caused most of the trouble in this world from Eve down, and the less you eat of them the better off you will be, and so will I.

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 2. SONG: SHAGGY MAN.
"AN APPLE'S THE CAUSE OF IT ALL."

lg.l: In the Garden of Eden stood
Its fruit was not much good.
Then long came a serpent mighty slick
And told 'em an apple they should pick
And eat it quick, and they did the trick
An apple's the cause of the fall,
To eat it was surely considered unlawful,
But Eve took a bite and then Adam a jawfull:
The pain that it gave 'em was just something awful--
An apple's the cause of it all.
In the orchard was an apple.
With the apple had to grapple.
It laid 'em out in a minute or two,
And that's just what it'll do to you;
So the apple you had best eschew,
Some folks eat it green when they think it is ripe
And it gets in its work with an octopus gripe;
I'd much prefer Jeffries would give me a swipe--
And the apple's the cause of it all.
And tries your pain to ease.
But the apple laughs at the measely pill,
And the secton digs in the grave-yard still;
For as long as an apple has its will
And wish I could eat 'em all!
It's a matter of taste, and the more diabolic
Your agony is, why, the more it will frolic,
And if you expire in a fit of the colic
An apple's the cause of it all!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Dear me, I shouldn't think you'd dare eat apples.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Somebody's got to eat 'em, or they'd get so plentiful the whole world would be one big tummy-ache. I'm willing to sacrifice myself by eating all I can get, in a vain effort to save humanity.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Are you a rose?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Well, I rose from where I fell; didn't i?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: But this is a hot-house devoted especially to roses. They've turned me out, and I suppose they'll turn you out, too.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Nothing ever turns out the way you expect. (Points to mule)
Who's your friend?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: His name is Hank.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Ah, a rag and a bone and a hank of hair.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: How's that?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Hank is Henry; and Henry is Harry---so Hank's hairy, isn't he?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Sure! I never thought of that.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: This is hen-nery, I s'pose.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: No; that's Baden-Baden.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Why didn't you get a good'n-good'n?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: When?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: When you were under the hen-roost.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: She's my own little chicken, that I raised from an egg.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: How'd you raise the egg?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Never you mind. What's your name?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: They call me Shaggy Man. Lost the family bible and can't remember what I was christened. Very young at the time.

sp.speaker: GARDENER
sp.stage: (ENTERING hastily, with an air of importance)
sp.p: Say, folks, you'll have to get out of here.

div.stage: (HANK makes a dash at him and GARDENER files out R.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: How did you happen to stray into these gardens?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Looking for my brother.

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're wrong. No family resemblance.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Where is your brother?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Still looking for him. Want to hear the story of my life?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Is it copyright?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: No, it's all wrong. Brother and I owned a mine in Colorado--- real mine--no stocks. Scooped out gold nuggets by the pail-full, Oh, joy! One day I left brother digging in the mine. When I came back he was gone---mine was gone--- everything gone. Oh, mis'ry!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: And there were no stockholders?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Nary one.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: How strange!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Couldn't understand it at first. Then I found on the spot where the mine had been, an asbestos letter. Here it is.

div.stage: (Hands paper to BETSY)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p:
"This mine is mine, so I have taken it away to my underground kingdom, and with it the audacious mortal who was robbing
OZMA.-----13.
me of my gold. Let this be a warning to mankind not to interfere with the right of, SIGNED: The Metal Monarch." Goodness me, who's the Metal Monarch?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: That's a hard question to answer. He's metal.

sp.speaker: GARDENER:
sp.p: Say, isn't it about time to move on?

div.stage: (HANK makes a bolt for GARDENER who EXITS R.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Time to move, all right.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I've heard of the Copper King, and the Steel King; but I never before heard of the Metal Monarch. Where does he live?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: He didn't give his address.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: And is your brother still in his power?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: He must be. Brother's broke out of jail seven times, but the Metal Kingdom must be too strong for him. Never mind. I mean to find my brother some day, and rescue him.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: How?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I can't imagine. But as long as I've got the Love Magnet I'm not worrying.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: What's the Love Magnet?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Sh--h--h! I'll show you.

sp.speaker: GARDENER:
sp.stage: (ENTERING with pitchfork. HANK starts to run at him, sees pitchfork and turns and hides behind BETSY.)
sp.p: Say folks, this won't do. You've no right in this place and I've been ordered to put you out.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Wait a minute. Shaggy Man is just going to show me the Love Magnet.

sp.speaker: GARDENER:
sp.p: What sort of a thing is that?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: It's a new invention; Dan Cupid patentee. Whoever owns the Love Magnet wins the love of everyone he meets. No courting, car-fares, flowers or theatre tickets. No trouble to borrow money; always welcome when you visit your friends. Fine, ain't it? I own this Love Magnet; and here it is!

div.stage: (Takes from his pocket a shining silver magnet. Immediately the GARDENER tries to embrace him, while BETSY leans against the SHAGGY MAN and puts her arms around his neck. The mule comes and kneels down at this feet and rubs his head against SHAGGY MAN'S legs, while chicken flies from BETSY's shoulder to that of SHAGGY MAN.

sp.speaker: GARDENER:
sp.p: Say, you're the best thing that ever happened, even if you are shaggy. Here, take this money; it's all I've got, but you're welcome to it. I love you so much I'm sorry I haven't got more to give you.
sp.stage: (Offers SHAGGY a handful of coins which latter takes and puts in his pocket.)

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You see, my dear, the Magnet works perfectly.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Gee! I wish I had it.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: There's only one in the world and I intend to hang on to it.

sp.speaker: ROSE MAIDENS:
sp.p: Have you put them out, Gardener?

sp.speaker: GARD:
sp.p: No, indeed! Come here, my beauties, and see this wonderful thing called a Love Magnet.

div.stage: (ROSE MAIDENS ENTER and form group behind PRINCIPALS

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 3. Waltz Song. DUET: SHAGGY MAN and BETSY.
"THE MAGNET OF LOVE."

lg.l: When bright eyes grow tender and brighter,
When smiles are both dimpled and sweet;
When hearts are contented and lighter
And red lips delicious to meet:
That's working by Cupid's own laws:
The Magnet of Love is the cause.
The Magnet of Love is the rarest
Of gifts that have come from above;
It quickens the humblest and fairest---
Love, love, the Magnet of Love!
True hearts it is always attracting!
For the Magnet of Love is distracting.
We know there are glances magnetic
That challenge the heart to respond:
We know there are murmers pathetic
That win for us whispering fond;
Can equal this token I name--
When two eager hearts are cemented
The Magnet of Love is to blame.
The Magnet of Love is the rarest
Of gifts that have come from above:
It quickents the humblest and finest--
Love, love, the Magnet of Love!
Though it makes us its slave--
To the Magnet of Love all are flocking.

div.stage: (At conclusion of song, the ROSE MAIDENS hover around SHAGGY MAN trying to embrace him; seizing his hands, etc. BETSY and GARDENER indignantly try to keep them away. SHAGGY MAN kisses one or two of the ROSES, at which BETSY jealously renews her efforts.)

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: It's no use, my dear, they've seen the Love Magnet and every one of their hearts is mine.

sp.speaker: MOSS ROSE:
sp.p: Take your pick, Shaggy Man!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I'm no ditch-digger. (Chucks her under chin)

sp.speaker: TEA ROSE:
sp.p: We give you every leaf---every leaf is yours.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I'll turn over a new one. (Kisses her)

sp.speaker: JACQUE ROSE:
sp.p: You're welcome to every scent we have.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I'll open a bank.
sp.stage: (BETSY and GARDENER try to keep ROSES away from SHAGGY MAN.
sp.p: Don't interfere. It's nice to be loved, even by a crowd. I forgive them all, Gardy.

sp.speaker: GARDENER:
sp.p: That won't help you. I, myself, love you dearly; but you are intruding in this place and its my duty to arrest you all.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY and BETSY:
sp.p: Arrest us!

sp.speaker: GARD:
sp.p: Yes: put you in our glass jail.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Wouldn't that jar us, though!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: We'll break out----sash-ay to liberty, so to speak---and shatter our hopes.

sp.speaker: MOSS ROSE:
sp.p: You mustn't do that.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Why not? If you had as many aches as you have panes, you'd be glad to get rid of 'em.

sp.speaker: TEA ROSE:
sp.p: It's against our laws.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Laws sakes! Who makes the rules and regulations of this green-house?

sp.speaker: GARD:
sp.p: Not me. They're printed in a book. Page 13: "If any strangers enter they must be arrested and put to death, being condemned by the Ruler."

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Who's the Ruler?

sp.speaker: GARD:
sp.p: There isn't any.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Then we're safe.

sp.speaker: GARD:
sp.p: You see, the Rulers of the Rose Kingdom all row on bushes in the Royal Gardens, and the last one we had got bug-house and had to be planted before his time. Just now there is none ripe enough to pick; so there's no Ruler to succeed him.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: How do you know?

sp.speaker: GARD:
sp.p: I'm the Royal Gardener.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Can't you take measures to get another Ruler?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Why don't you pick a green-horn? Seems to me it's a poor Ruler that don't work both ways.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Take us to see these queer gardens, won't you?

sp.speaker: GARD:
sp.p: No; a thousand times, no!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Once is enough.

sp.speaker: GARD:
sp.p: You shall be seized and imprisoned.
sp.stage: (Grabs BETSY'S arm. HANK strikes out with heels, so GARDENER releases BETSY and starts to run.

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Don't you love me, Gardy?

div.stage: (GARDENER hesitates, glancing at HANK.

sp.speaker: ROSES:
sp.p: We do!

div.stage: (They run to SHAGGY and try to embrace him again)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Scat! You leave the Shaggy Man along, you wall-flowers! What you need is some Paris green.

sp.speaker: ROSES:
sp.p: We love him.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: That isn't your fault, my dears, and I don't blame you. Also it isn't my fault. But what I want to know is, if Gardy, here, loves me?

sp.speaker: GARD:
sp.p: I dote on thee.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: He's in his dotage. I'm afraid the Gardener's a sad rake, and eats too much hoe-cake. Any girl that married him would have to wear weeds and eat prunes.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Gardy, lead us to the Royal Gardens, for the love of me.

sp.speaker: GARD:
sp.p: I'll do it. It's agin the laws, but I'll do it. When a fellow's in love he isn't responsible.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Hurray! Where are the Royal Gardens?

sp.speaker: ROSES and GARD:
sp.p: Here!

div.stage: (They turn toward background, which gradually disappears and discovers the ROYAL GARDENS.

div.head: SUPPLEMENTARY SETTING to SCENE 1.--THE ROYAL GARDENS.--A

div.stage: Dark change, and a Transformation of the rear drops, caused by the lights being raised behind the gauze and lowered in front, discovers these Gardens beautifully illuminated. The ROYAL GARDENS consist of a row of trees with a high hedge in the extreme background, bearing beautiful flowers illuminated with electric lights. Upon the low branches of the trees, people are growing in every stage of development. There are fluffy blossoms with baby faces in them, babies and children of all sizes standing among the leaves and low foliage, and, in the foreground, (C.) upon a low limb, is a Royal Princess of rare beauty. She is motionless, but fully developed, daintily dressed, and seemingly "all ready to pick". ROSES and GARDENER kneeling to form a picture. The SHAGGY MAN and BETSY and HANK in central group facing the ROYAL GARDENS.

div.head: MUSICAL NUMBER 4. Concerted Number:

sp.speaker: ROSE:
sp.l: See the Royal Gardens where our Rulers are maturing;

lg.l: Isn't it a pretty sight, pleasant and alluring?
On their stems they gently sway;
Bud and blossom, too, are they;
They'll be ripe and plucked some day,

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.stage: (Approaching tree on which OZMA stands. During this number the ROSES rise and stand in a group around SHAGGY MAN, at L. where they softly sing the "Magnet of Love", as a counter-theme. One verse, with Refrain repeated.)

lg.l: Art living? Oh, answer me quick!
Speak, and I'll gladly obey thee;
Thy form I am longing to pick.
'Tis shame that so charming a creature--
One destined by fate to command,
When she should be ruling the land.
So long I've been patiently waiting
Your presence I welcome with joy:
Now! Now! Pray gather me now!
That I may be Queen of the Roses--
Dear Princess, I'll gladly obey you,
If you in return promise me
To guard and protect us, and say you
Will set us poor prisoners free.
Yes, yes, I promise you true!
The word of a Princess receiving,

div.stage: (BETSY assists OZMA to the ground. The ROSES and GARDENER now rush forward, followed by the SHAGGY MAN.)

lg.l: A girl can never rule us!
So do not try to fool us!
I have come to rule you
Out in the cold world dolorous;
No one but a man shall rule o'er us!
And with you this brute (Points HANK)
And the girl, here, to boot;
And the Shaggy Man with you must roam.
Out in the cold world dolorus.

sp.speaker: OZMA, SHAGGY MAN, BETSY: )
sp.l: A wandering life is before us.

sp.speaker: ROSE CHORUS and GARDENER:)
sp.l: No one but a man can ruler o'er us.

div.stage: END OF SCENE 1.
DARK CHANGE TO SCENE 2.

div.head:
OZMA OF OZ
ACT I.
SCENE 2.
---

div.stage: ACT I.-- SCENE 2.--(In 2.)--A CROSS-ROADS.-- (Setting as per Mr. Voegtlin's diagram.)--In C. is an old- fashioned well with chain supposed to support a bucket. The Scene opens with a Rainstorm effect prepared by Mr. Voegtlin--- something entirely new. As the rain ceases, a rainbow descends, and back of this bow is seen the CHORUS of RAINBOW MAIDENS.)

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 5. (a) Instrumental: "SUMMER RAINSTORM." (b) RAINBOW CHORUS and DANCE.
---

lg.l: We're the daughters of the Rainbow
In the clouds our palace stands,
In the realm our sire commands.
When the great world just beneath us
All our sky-land is a dry land
And a merry life is ours.
Well we know our sunny bow
We're as happy as the day
Though to earth we sometimes stray

div.stage: POLYCHROME, one of the Rainbow's daughters, dances down the arch upon the stage. The bow lifts and disappears with CHORUS. Stage lightens, disclosing the setting distinctly for the first time.)

sp.speaker: POLYCHROME:
sp.p: Oh, oh! There goes the Rainbow and my sisters with it! Dear me! What shall I do? How careless of me to wander on this cold earth instead of remaining in safety. And here I must stay---in this dreary place---until there is another rainstorm and the rainbow comes again.

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 6.
SOLO: POLYCHROME:
"WHEN THE RAINBOW COMES AGAIN."
OZMA-----23.
WHEN THE RAINBOW COMES AGAIN.
---

lg.l: Cold is the world---mortals it's sport!
Clouds drift across life's most glorious dreams.
Strive through we may, Fortune to court,
Fate is more just than it frequently seems.
Close to our joy, follows despair,
Love and ambition seem joyless and drear;
Yet there's a hope banishes care:
A rainbow of Promise is sure to appear.
Courage then should guide us all

div.stage: (ENTER BETSY, HANK, OZMA, SHAGGY MAN. The mule goes to the well and examines it.)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Oh, what a darling creature!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I'm the most miserable girl in the whole world.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Tell us your troubles, pretty one.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I've lost my bow.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Take me!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I don't want you. I want my rainbow.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Don't I reign in your heart?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: No, you don't.

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

div.stage: (He tumbles half way into the well and gets stuck. SHAGGY MAN and BETSY run to assist him, but he kicks so vigorously they don't dare go near. SHAGGY MAN throws a chain around HANK and winds up the windlass, drawing him up from the well.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Where is your rainbow, dear?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: It's gone, and left me on this cold, horrid earth. I just danced down the end of the bow to the ground for a moment, not realizing my danger, and when I looked around the bow had gone.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Then you must stay with us until you find it again.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Where do you live?

div.stage: (The SHAGGY MAN and BETSY now rejoin them. HANK is again examining the well.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: We live wherever we happen to be, for we are wanderers, Betsy and me, and Princess Ozma has been exiled from her own country. You are welcome, my dear, to join our party.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I don't like you.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: No?
sp.stage: (Holds up the Love Magnet. She clasps her hands and advances eagerly toward him.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I love you!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p:
Of course you do. But you can't help it, my dear---it's the
OZMA-----25. Love magnet. Now then, can you tell us where all these roads lead to?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: No; most beautiful and bewitching one. I have never been here before.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I'm a stranger in these parts myself. What is your name, dear?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I'm called Polychrome.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Goodness me! What a hard name to say. It reminds me of a cross between a parrot and a paint-box. May I call you Polly for short?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: If you like. But where are you all going to?
Do you know the way to some place?

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: No, dear. I've just been picked. This is my first experience outside the Rose Gardens where I grew. We were driven out by my rebellious subjects, who wanted a man to rule over them, and so we have wandered to this place. But there are so many roads we can't decide which one to take.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: If you're the Rainbow's daughter you ought to know some magic. Don't you?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: A little, not much. This magic wand will do some things for me up in the skies; but I'm not sure it will always work down here upon the earth.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Suppose you try it, and see.

sp.speaker: A VOICE:
sp.p: Use com-mon sense.

div.stage: (All start

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Why, what was that?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: That must have been Hank.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Nonsense; Hank can't talk. But what did it mean? Common sense can't help us.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: No; for I've got a pocket full of it.

div.stage: (Shows coins the GARDENER gave to him.)

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Nothing can help us, I'm afraid.

sp.speaker: VOICE
sp.p: Fid-dle-stickes!

div.stage: (All start and SHAGGY MAN approaches the mule.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Hank, are you kidding us?

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Suppose you use your magic wand on my dear old mule and discover whether he has learned to talk, or not?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Very well.

div.stage: (She approaches mule and waves her wand over him. He strikes out with his heels and SHAGGY goes rolling over on stage. HANK follows, while BETSY tries to restrain him. Humorous bus. between SHAGGY, BETSY and mule, while OZMA and POLY. slowly EXIT, arm in arm, along one road.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Hi, there, Polly! Where in thunder's the girl with the magic wand?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: She's wand-ering.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Well, her magic won't go with Hank, that's sure. If I had an axe I'd show you what would go.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Don't you hurt Hank. He's my best friend.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: But he hasn't any Love Magnet.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Yes he has; there's a magnet on each of his hoofs. That's why I love him.

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 7. SONG: BETSY.
"DEAR OLD HANK."

lg.l: There are many kinds of treasures,
There are many kinds of jew'ls;
There are many kinds of pleasures,
There are many kinds of mules.
But I'll make a statement frank;
There are many kinds of kickers---
There are those whose howls and bickers
Make us tired of their bray;
But in all my times of trouble
All my lucky stars I thank
That I have won a champion
And he's rather lean and lank:
Or dare his tail to yank--

div.stage: (During this number the mule dances and cavorts, acting as if he comprehended BETSY'S words. The SHAGGY MAN meantime sits on the well-curb, looking into the well, and at the conclusion of song he calls BETSY.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Look here, Betsy! I believe old Hank saw something strange in this well.

sp.speaker: BETSY
sp.p: He did?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Yes; Hank was hankering for something down here, and that's what made him act so foolish and mulish.

div.stage: (Together they look down the well.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Ha! Let's see what it is?
sp.stage: (SHAGGY winds up chain, and dumps a lot of old junk--such as an old-fashioned hoop-skirt, tin pails, etc. He holds up dead cat)
sp.p: Ding, dong, dell--pussy in the well!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Throw it away. Ugh!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: It's part of the catagory. But there's something more down there, I guess.

div.stage: (Drops bucket again.

sp.speaker: BETSY
sp.p: Up with it, then!

div.stage: (SHAGGY draws up bucket and dumps out TIKTOK, who is huddled in a heap, rusted and motionless. They look at it curiously, while HANK proceeds to prance around them.)
(ENTER OZMA and POLYCHROME.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: What have you found, beautiful one?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: We haven't named it yet. (Rolls TIKTOK over with his foot.)

sp.speaker: BETSY
sp.p: Looks like a copper man.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Looks like anything you want to call it.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: There's so many dents in him we might call him an accident.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Do you think he's alive?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Not yet. All he's good for is old metal--half a cent a pound at the junk shop.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Here's a sign. Let's read it.

"Smith and Tinker's Patent Adjustable, Triple-Action, Automatic Clockwork man, TIKTOK. Warranted to keep in any climate and prepared in comformance with the Pure Food and Drugs Act. Mechnaism guaranteed for a thousand years. Any infringments will be vigorously prosecuted."

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Dear me!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: How strange!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: He's a wonder!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Isn't he complicated, though? But here's more. Listen!

"Directions for Use: Wind up the Clockwork Man under his left arm and he will think as cleverly as any rich man's son in the world. Wind him up under his right arm and he will speak as correctly as an after-dinner orator. Wind him up in the center of his breast and he will move in a natural and intelligent manner and act as well as Edwin Forrest."

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Ah, now we know when he was made---sometime in the last Century.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Then he ought to work yet, if we wind him up.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Yes, he's guaranteed for a thousand years; perhaps he was intended for a Chorus Girl. Where's the key?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: This must be it.
sp.stage: (He picks up key from a heap of metal.
sp.p: Now let's get him ready for the operation.

div.stage: (BETSY and SHAGGY raise TIKTOK to his feet and move his joints so that he will stand upright. He sways and topples this way and that until they get him balanced so he stands steadily. HANK prances joyfully around. The others are all much interested in the proceedings.)

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: What is that thing on his forehead?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Looks like an electric button. And here are some words on it: "Don't touch!"

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I wonder why not?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Can't say. But if we're going to follow directions we'd better not touch that button. Eh?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: All right. What part of him shall I wind up first?

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: His thoughts, of course.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Yes; set his think-works going. If they work all right he'll be a free thinker.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Which is his left arm?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: That's the right one.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: But I want the left.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Of course: the left one's the right one, isn't it?

div.stage: (BETSY winds TIKTOK under left arm.)

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I don't see any difference, now he's wound.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Course you don't. He's just thinking.

sp.speaker: OZMA
sp.p: Oh, is he?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: He don't look it.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Thinks don't show. Sometimes I think, myself.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I'll bet we've found a gold-brick.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Listen! Can't you hear him tick? (All listen)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Sure!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I can hear him go, "tick-tock!"

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Wind up his phonograph, Betsy, and see if that ticks. If he isn't fake he's got to explain himself.

sp.speaker: BETSY
sp.p: I will. Which is the right arm?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: The one left.

div.stage: (BETSY winds TIKTOK under right arm.

sp.speaker: TIKTOK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks!

div.stage: (All start back and exclaim. TIKTOK always speaks in a monotone.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Bully for you, Tiktok!
sp.stage: (Slaps TIKTOK on back. The Clockwork Man collapses and falls in a heap. Rattling of metal off stage.)

sp.speaker: TIKTOK:
sp.p: Pick-me-up-pick-me-up-pick-me-up-pick---
sp.stage: (Continues this phrase until raised to his feet

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Good gracious! Pick him up!

div.stage: (They raise TIKTOK and stand him on his feet.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Well, his phonograph's all right, but I'm inclined to doubt the think-works.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: When in doubt breed mumps---

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: You mean lead trumps.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I mean what I say.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're wrong.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I'm right according to my ma-chin-er-y.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Then your machinery's out of gear.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Z-z-z-z-
Don't blame me, blame the pat-en-tee.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: What's wrong with your speech works?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Some of the cogs are missing in that wheel.

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: All right, Tiktok; we'll take your record for it.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: What record?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I don't know whether it's an Edison or a Victor.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: To the Victor belongs the boils.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're wrong. You mean spoils.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I mean what I say, and I'll back my ma-chin-er-y to be cor-rect. Wind up my act-ion and I'll fight a du-el with you.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Not any. We don't fight duels these days. If you're going to make trouble you don't act, so there!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Oh, wind up his action. I don't care. Hank will protect me; won't you Hank?

div.stage: (Mule kicks out toward TIKTOK, who again collapses with sound of rattling metal and tumbles in a heap.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Pick-me-up-pick-me-up-pick-me-up-pick-----
Ma-ny thanks!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: He's all right.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Wind me tight and I'll show I'm all right and can go.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Oh, do wind up his action, Betsy!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Here we go. I may be encouraging another bad actor; but that's not my fault.

div.stage: (She winds TIKTOK on his breast. He moves automaticaly around in a circle and then comes to a stop, front. The Clockwork Chorus ENTERS.

(NOTE: Each girl has a clock over her head, her face appearing in the center of the dial. From this a golden pendulum is suspended and sways back and forth against her dark skirts, which she holds spread out as she dances. Also in her hand she has a "cricket" to sound "tick-tock" as required. At the repetition of the second refrain the clocks all strike the hour, or could even play the melody as they strike, each clock having a bell in one corner, which can be rung by a cord running to the girl's hand. This will all be arranged by Mr. Klein in the music score.)

div.head: MUSICAL NUMBER 8. SONG: TIKTOK, Principals and Chorus

lg.l: I'm a man of ma-ny parts and compli-ca-ted,
I can run be-cause I'm fine-ly reg-u-lat-ed,
Right on time you-'re al-ways sure to find me,
If my works run down you must-n't mind me,
Take the key and then pro-ceed to wind up
And my gen-ius I will show--------

sp.speaker: TIKTOK:)__
sp.l: ( Don't de-mand a cent of pay!

sp.speaker: TIKTOK:)______
sp.l: ( Show my e-qual if you can!

lg.l: ( Mor-tal man has no stem-wind-ing works to guide him
( No one knows what dev-il-ry there lurks in-side
( In my case I'm al-ways true and trust-y:
Ne-ver get too must-y or too dust-y;
Keep my oiled and I am ne-ver rust-y
And a thousand years I'll last.---

sp.speaker: CHORUS:)
sp.stage: (Refrain is again repeated, when after a line or two TIKTOK with a gurgle, stops singing and waves his hands to indicate his speech has run down. The Principals pick up the air.)

lg.l: Show his equal if you can!

sp.stage: (Here TIKTOK's motion runs down and he stops abruptly in an absurd posture and remains motionless while the refrain continues.

div.stage: (At conclusion of refrain Clockwork Chorus EXITS.)

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Oh, dear; look at him, Betsy! He's run down.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Poor man; how dreadful! Wind him up.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: All right.

div.stage: (She winds his speech.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Don't mention it.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Why, he's quite an institution, this fellow. Say, Tiktok, there's no alarm inside you, is there?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: No. For that reason I ne-ver strike.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Good for you.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Perhaps this queer man can tell us which road to take.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Where to?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Why, I want to find the way to the Kingdom of the Metal Monarch.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I know the ras-cal.

sp.speaker: ALL
sp.p: Oh, you do!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: He threw me in the well.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Well, well!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Be-cause my ma-chin-er-y would not do his wick-ed bid-ding.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Oh, wouldn't it?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: No, be-cause the Met-al Mon-arch is in-fluen-ced by hate, and on-ly love can con-trol my mech-an-ism.

sp.speaker: BETSY, OZMA, POLY:
sp.p: Love!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: It's love that makes the wheels go 'round.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You mean the world go 'round.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I mean what I say.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're wrong.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I'm right ac-cord-ing to my mach-in-er-y.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Then I don't need to wind you up.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Yes you do; you have the key to my af-fect-ions, and my af-fect- ions are my wheels, be-cause they are the on-ly things that af-fect me.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Tell us, then; which road leads you to the Metal Kingdom?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: You take the--gr-r-r---bib-i-kib-i-gig-a-chug-kik-a-dik-----

div.stage: (As he mumbles incoherently, they shrink away from him.)

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Oh, dear! What's gone wrong now?

sp.speaker: SHAGG:
sp.p: It's his think-works. They've run down.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Wind them up, Betsy! Quick!

div.stage: (as TIKTOK continues to mumble, BETSY winds him up under the left arm.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks! Beg par-don for go-ing dip-py, but if a man's thoughts run down he's out of his bus-'ness.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: True. Many a man needs his think-machine wound up.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I was a-bout to say that-----

div.stage: (Stops short and waves his arms wildly.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Oh, it's his talk-works, now. Guess I didn't wind 'em very tight.

div.stage: (Winds him under right arm.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Tiktok, I'm ashamed of you. Your carburetor is sadly out of order. You need more gasoline.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Don't blame me. Blame-z-z-z-z-the pat-en-tee!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Cog slipped, eh? Well, tell us, before you go dead again, which road leads to the Metal Monarch's Kingdom.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I won't!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: No? Well, if love can influence your one-cylinder meter, I'll make you tell me.

div.stage: (Holds up Love Magnet. TIKTOK at once advances and embraces SHAGGY, who tries to escape, and cries for help. HANK runs up and kicks TIKTOK, who falls in a heap. They put him on his feet again, and he leans his head on SHAGGY MAN'S shoulder and chucks him under the chin.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Toot-sie, woot-sie!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: He loves you, beautiful one.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Of course he does. now, Tiktok, will you tell me the road to the Metal Monarch's Kingdom?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I can't, hon-ey love.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Why not?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I don't know the road.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: That's pleasant. Hank knows as much as this junk-shop, and more.
Don't you, Hank?

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!
sp.stage: (He prances up stage and points a hoof along one of the roads.)

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Is that the way, Hank?

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: He wants us to hoof it.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Come on, folks! I told you Hank would know. That mule is as wise as the mummy of Solomon.

div.stage: (They all EXIT up stage, followed by TIKTOK. Presently the Clockwork Man stops short and calls out.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Help! Wind-me-up-wind-me-up-wind-me-up-wind------

div.stage: (BETSY runs in and winds him.)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Goodness me! What a run down condition you're in. Hurry up now, Tiktok!

div.stage: (BETSY EXITS followed by TIKTOK who with awkward movements runs into wings; backs out: turns abrupt corners and finally heads for the road and marches out.

(Trumpets sound in distance, heard faintly at first, then louder and swelling into March Number. ENTER the Army of Oogaboo, headed by QUEEN ANN SOFORTH. This army consists of 17 people---- 4 generals, 4 colonels, 4 majors, 4 captains and one private.)

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 9. MARCH SONG and CHORUS: QUEEN ANN and ARMY.
"THE ARMY OF OOGABOO."
---

lg.l: And this here is meh ar-my!
I'll confide a fact to you:

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.l: We can fight to beat the band----

lg.l: Foemen see us, quickly flee us--
Every one would like to be us!
We are the Army of Oogaboo!
If we fight and run away
That is why we always cry:

sp.speaker: ALL OFFICERS:
sp.l: No army in the universe can march as well as he!

sp.speaker: ALL OFFICERS:
sp.l: No Army in the Universe can halt as quick as he!

lg.l: Blood's a dreadful thing to see--
An' so we never shed it,
We can't bear to hurt a flea--
But we seem so fierce and grand

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.l: No one dares us to withstand--

lg.l: We're a sight that's most entrancing

sp.speaker: QUEEN ANN:
sp.p: My brave boys, we've come all the way from home, seeing adventures, and your advent hasn't turned up any excitement so far.

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: (Speaking together.) That's not our fault!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: No sass! Be respectful, or I'll dock your pay.

sp.speaker: PRIVATE FILES:
sp.p: You can't dock mine, Your Majesty.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Why not?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Because I don't get any pay. All I get is promises.

sp.speaker: GENERALS:
sp.p: That's all we get, Private.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: I'm a man of high birth. Whenever I travel I take an upper. This life is not what I expected when I enlisted.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: What did you expect?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: War! Carnage! Devastation, conflict and blood!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: But that would be wrong. If that's what you want you ought to go hunting lions in Africa. Eh, Colonels?

sp.speaker: COLONELS:
sp.p: True, Your Majesty.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: I've had enough of it. I'm going to resign.

sp.speaker: ALL OFFICERS:
sp.p: What!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: You can't, Private. You're the only Army we have. So you may as well be resigned to your fate, for it's the only resignation I'll accept.

sp.speaker: GENERAL:
sp.p: If we lose the private---

sp.speaker: COLONEL:
sp.p: We won't have anybody to-----

sp.speaker: MAJOR:
sp.p: Command, and that would break us up----

sp.speaker: CAPTAIN:
sp.p: ----in business!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Very true. But there's another reason.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: What is it?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: I love you. You're the pride of meh heart and the idol of meh---

sp.speaker: FILES
sp.p: Pshaw! What's love got to do with the Army?

sp.speaker: GENERAL:
sp.p: Sir, a soldier's---

sp.speaker: COLONEL:
sp.p: ---chief duty---

sp.speaker: MAJOR:
sp.p: ---is to win the hearts---

sp.speaker: CAPTAIN:
sp.p: --of women!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: And you've won mine, Private.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: I don't want it.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Do you intend to obey my orders?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: I didn't enlist to----

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: You enlisted to obey orders. I'm going to command you to marry me and become my royal consort.

sp.speaker: GENERAL:
sp.p: If you do that---

sp.speaker: COLONEL:
sp.p: ---Your majesty may as well--

sp.speaker: MAJOR:
sp.p: --disband the whole--

sp.speaker: CAPTAIN
sp.p: Bloomin' army!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Can't I hire another private?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Where can you find another victim to take my place?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Why not?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: You don't pay, so the job don't pay.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Pay! Pay! Is this an army of mercenaries or the Army of Oogaboo? Who cares for money?

sp.speaker: ARMY:
sp.p: We do!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Listen, then! Here we are in a foreign country. It looks prosperous; so tomorrow we'll conquer it and divide the spoils.

sp.speaker: ARMY:
sp.p: Hurray!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: But you mustn't hurt anybody.

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: No, Your Majesty!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: I will! I'll kill, slay, murder, butcher--- anything for excitement!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Why don't you marry me?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: I---I'm not brave enough.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Officers, prepare to make camp on this spot.

sp.speaker: GENERALS:
sp.p: Attention!

sp.speaker: COLONELS:
sp.p: Attention!

sp.speaker: MAJORS:
sp.p: Attention!

sp.speaker: CAPTAINS:
sp.p: Attention!

sp.speaker: GENERALS:
sp.p: Break!

sp.speaker: COLONELS:
sp.p: Break!

sp.speaker: MAJORS:
sp.p: Break!

sp.speaker: CAPTAINS:
sp.p: Break!

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Ranks!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: The ranks are broke already.

sp.speaker: GENERALS:
sp.p: Make!

sp.speaker: COLONELS:
sp.p: Make!

sp.speaker: MAJORS:
sp.p: Make!

sp.speaker: CAPTAINS:
sp.p: Make!

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Camp!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: That's it; if there's any work, it's up to me. If there's any pay----

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Obey orders, sir! Come officers, let us explore the enemy's territory!

div.stage: (EXIT ANN with OFFICERS. FILES takes off knapsack and unfolds a small toy tent, which he sets up on stage.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Talk about warfare! I haven't seen anything fair since I've been in this business----
sp.stage: (ENTER OZMA, hastily. Stops abruptly on seeing FILES.)
sp.p: ----until now! Your servant, my dear!

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Oh, I didn't know you were here! I've lost all my friends.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: And found another! I'm Private Files, of the Army of Oogaboo. And you-----?

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: I'm Princess Ozma of Roseland, but my subjects have driven me into exile because they wanted a man to rule over them.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Now that is strange. So lovely a blossom should have more devoted subjects; and, if your own foresake you, here is another at your feet.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: I'm afraid you can't help me.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: I can do anything. Why, I'm the whole army, except the officers. Try me and see.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: My friends and I are trying to find the way to the Metal Kingdom; but we don't know which road to take.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Why don't you call upon your cousins to assist you?

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: My cousins?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Yes, my fair Rose Princess. Are not the Field Flowers your cousins, humble though they are?

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Of course.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: They must know where the roads lead to, for the Field Flowers have listened to travelers for ages.

div.head: MUSICAL NUMBER 10. DUET: OZMA and FILES.
div.stage:
"ASK THE FLOWERS TO TELL YOU."
---

lg.l: "He loves me, or loves me not!"
Then the flower is soon forgot.

div.stage:
------------
(Chorus girls ENTER with big daisies, each having 16 petals. They pluck off a petal at each line, and EXIT when all are fallen.)
-----------
REFRAIN:

lg.l: Ask the flowers to tell you
And they'll always tell you true:
When you're puzzled or in doubt
Ask the flowers to tell you
And they'll always tell you true.
To your chin you hold it up---
When it tints your face with gold;
Is the message when it's told.

div.stage:
------------
(Chorus girls ENTER with big Buttercups, which they hold beneath their chins. These buttercups light electrically, flooding their faces with yellow hues.)
-----------
(REFRAIN as before.

lg.l: If you'll answer yes or no.
He won't have to guess it,
By the color that they show.
And your suit you may not press.

div.stage:
--------
(Chorus girls ENTER in a line showing large red roses placed above each girls' left ear. Then they turn about, forming line in opposite direction, and show white roses placed in same manner above right ear. They may remain to sing Refrain or EXIT.)
----------
(Refrain repeated as after first verse.

div.head:
OZMA OF OZ.
---
ACT I.
---
SCENE 3.
---

div.stage:
ACT I.--SCENE 3.--HOME OF THE FIELD FLOWERS.--Special Scenic effects by Mr. Voegtlin. See diagram for setting.
---
(ENTER the mule, HANK. He squats in center of stage, and with a wave of his hoof beckons the others to hurry, as he has evidently out-distanced them. ENTER POLYCHROME.)

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p:
Ah, but you've led us a chase, and it's lucky my feet were
light enough to follow you.
Where are the others, most beautiful loved one?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Oh, they'll be here presently, if Betsy don't wear out the key winding up the junk-shop. Some of Tiktok's clockwork runs down every few minutes. (Sits on stump.) I've tired myself out trying to hurry him up.

div.stage: (ENTER BETSY.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Look here, Shaggy Man: I'm not going to play valet to Tiktok any longer.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Where is he?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Somewhere on the way. But it's a winding way and I've turned the key on him for the last time. There it is.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I wonder why his inventors didn't give him perpetual motion? Perhaps they tried and failed. Something stops his clock every few minutes. Wonder if its you, Betsy?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: (Voice heard from outside) Wind-me-up-wind-me-up-wind----

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: There he is now. Who's going to give him another start in life?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I will! I love to hear him tick.
sp.stage: (She picks up key and runs out. Presently in marches TIKTOK and runs against the mule. HANK kicks and TIKTOK collapses in a heap. They raise him to his feet and SHAGGY places ear to TIKTOK's chest.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Heart still beating---he lives!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Have an apple?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Can't eat.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Why not?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Have-n't an-y swal-low mach-in-er-y.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I have. See the swallows homeward fly. (He eats.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: You're a bird.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Now look here, old man; if you run down again I'm going to push that button on your forehead.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: You'd ruin my-z-z-z-z-z-ma-chin-er-y.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: That wouldn't matter. Your machinery is so old and worn out it probably came out of Noah's Ark.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Per-haps. But it isn't the on-ly thing that was saved from the ark.

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 11. TRIO and DANCE.
TIKTOK, SHAGGY MAN, and BETSY.
(HANK, the mule assists in dance.)
"OH, NOAH."
---

lg.l: HE saved the whale, the high-priced quail,
The sardine box and the blondine looks
Of the girl of sweet sixteen.
That you saved us the very things

div.stage: (DANCE.)

lg.l: The jokes of dear Mark Twain,
He saved 'em all, both great and small
And they can't get lost again.
You had it in for us--
You might have drowned the curios
And saved a lot of fuss.

div.stage: (DANCE.

lg.l: He saved the boy musician, just to
To make us feel that life was real,
What made you treat us so?
You had a chance to soak 'em
But you let the freaks all go.

div.stage: (DANCE.)
(Verses ad lib.)

(Characters dance off stage to allow
ENTRANCE of QUEEN ANN and OFFICERS)

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Cheer up, Officers. Don't look so glum.

sp.speaker: GENERAL:
sp.p: Can't help it, your Maj----

sp.speaker: COLONEL:
sp.p: ---esty; the private is gone----

sp.speaker: MAJOR:
sp.p: ---and there is no one to command----

sp.speaker: CAPTAIN:
sp.p: ---to fight the foe!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: The private is a deserter. But although he has run away, my love for him remains.

sp.speaker: GEN. FUSS:
sp.p: But, Your Majesty, your love won't fight!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Won't it, though! You wait till I've married Private Files, and see.

div.stage: (ENTER: SHAGGY, BETSY, TIKTOK, and HANK.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Hello, what's this outfit?-----banditti?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Fellow, I'm Queen Ann of Oogaboo--and this is my army--all except Private Files. There's no private.

sp.speaker: TIKTOK:
sp.p: It's a pub-lic ar-my. "For-ward the tight bri-gade, Charge for the drinks, he said!"

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're wrong. "Forward the light brigade----"

sp.speaker: TIKTOK:
sp.p: I'm right according to my ma-chin-er-y.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Your machinery's on the bun.

sp.speaker: TIKTOK:
sp.p: Don't blame me--blame-z-z-z-z-z-z-z-z-the pat-en-tee.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: What's the good of an army in this forsaken place?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: We're here to conquer the world, inquisitive female.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Don't you call me a female! Hank, will you see me insulted?

div.stage: (HANK dives among the OFFICERS, kicking, and scatters them right and left.)

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Are you the original Queen Ann?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: I am, and I'm a terrible person when scorned.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: (Kissing his hand to Ann.) I think are love-ly.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: And you are right. Evidently you are a very proper man.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I am. My clock-work ticks on-ly for you.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: How sudden!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're queen high, now, Ann. Talk about being scorned---

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: The private scorned me, just the same. But wait till I catch him----that's all.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Poor fellow! I'll save him from your love.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: You can't.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Just watch me and see.
sp.stage: (He holds up Love Magnet. ANN makes a leap and clings around his neck.
sp.p: Hi, there! Help, somebody, help!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Sir, re-lease, the la-dy.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I can't. She won't let me.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: I love---I love but thee!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Where do I come in?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p:
You go out. Now, Ann--Ann! Be reasonable! I don't mind your loving me, for having seen the Love Magnet you can't help it.
OZMA-----57.
But you must remember you're only one of a crowd.

div.stage: (Releases himself and holds her at arm's length.)

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: You must be mine!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Can't think of it. I belong to the universe.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: You shall be my soldier. I need you to act as the army of Oogaboo.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: What's the pay?

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Promises!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Then I'll promise to be the army---some day, but not now.

sp.speaker: GEN. FUSS:
sp.p: We need a private---

sp.speaker: COL. KORN:
sp.p: ---to command, so we can order him---

sp.speaker: MAJ. KEY:
sp.p: ---to fight our battles, and----

sp.speaker: CAPT. YOUNG:
sp.p: ---conquer the world!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Ah, I have an idea! I need this outfit to fight and conquer the Metal Monarch---

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Who's he?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Ruler of the underground Metal Kingdom.

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Is he rich?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Owns all the metal in the world--gold, silver, copper, iron, politicians, radium, tin, life-insurance agents and brass.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Good! We'll conquer him!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: And release my dear brother from captivity!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: And with the booty we'll pay my army all their arrears of salary!

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: (Enthusiastic) Hurray!

sp.speaker: GEN. FUSS:
sp.p: But we---

sp.speaker: COL. KORN:
sp.p: ---haven't---

sp.speaker: CAPT. YOUNG:
sp.p: ---private soldier!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: We must have a private soldier, my love. But I'm afraid if you accept the post, you may be wounded, and that would break my heart.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Mine too! But stay! We'll make Tiktok the private.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Oh, no indeed! I can't fight and I can't run!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: You can if you're wound up, Tiktok!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: If I run much I run down.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: But the enemy can't hurt you. You're fire-proof.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: And always on your mettle.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: An ideal soldier!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: You re-fused my love, so I re-fuse to fight.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: He says his clockwork is only regulated by love.
Pretend to love him and you'll win an army.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Watch me! (Approaches TIKTOK) My darling Tiktok! Although Ilove another man in the flesh, you are the only clockwork individual I admire. Every wheel, pinion, spring and eccentric in your anatomy is dear to me. Say you'll be my army and I'll swear never to love another machine as I do you.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Fair Queen, you have my cog-wheels! I ac-cept your of-fer!

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Hurray!

sp.speaker: GEN. FUSS:
sp.p: With this noble army----

sp.speaker: COL. KORN:
sp.p: ---we'll march to victory!

sp.speaker: MAJ. KEY:
sp.p: We'll conquer or we'll die---

sp.speaker: CAPT. YOUNG:
sp.p: ---our whiskers!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Very good. Let us march on the Metal Kingdom at once!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Where is it?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: One of these roads leads to it, but we don't know which.

div.stage: (ENTER: POLYCHROME, dancing gaily.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I found them!

sp.speaker: ALL:
sp.p: Whom?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Princess Ozma and Private Files.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Where were they?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Kissing behind a rose-bush.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: How scan-da-lous!

div.stage: (ENTER: OZMA and FILES.)

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Not at all! I'm going to take the Army of Oogaboo to the RoseKingdom, conquer the rebellious subjects, and marry the Princess.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: You're too late, my good man. Your resignation has been accepted, and this noble soldier (Pointing to TIKTOK) is now the Army of Oogaboo.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: I thought you loved me.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Here is my love!
sp.stage: (Leaps and grabs SHAGGY around neck. He throws her off. She is caught by the Generals and whirled down the line of Colonels, Majors and Capatins-finally landing in TIKTOK's arms.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p:
Sir, you owe your escape to me. she loves me---
she loves you not!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Thank goodness!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Thank the Love Magnet. And now we're going to conquer the Metal Kingdom and rescue my brother from the Metal Monarch. That is, we're going as soon as we discover the way.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I'll show you the way.

sp.speaker: ALL:
sp.p: You!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Yes, if you will promise to help these true lovers as soon as you have conquered the Metal Monarch.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: It's a bargain.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: But this bunch of old iron can't fight! (Points to TIKTOK.)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: He's scrap-iron!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Oh, that's different.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Are you ready to march?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Just as soon as the army forms ranks. Officers, do your duty!

sp.speaker: GENERALS:
sp.p: Fall!

sp.speaker: COLONELS:
sp.p: Fall!

sp.speaker: MAJORS:
sp.p: Fall!

sp.speaker: CAPTAINS:
sp.p: Fall!

sp.speaker: ALL OFFICERS:
sp.p: In!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Fall in what?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Marching order.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Then wind me up.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: That's your job, Polly. (POLY. winds up TIKTOK)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks!

sp.speaker: ALL OFFICERS:
sp.p: Shun!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: You musn't in-ter-fere with my ten-sion or I won't work.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Now, Polly, show us the way to go.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: The Field Flowers will tell us the way.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: These creatures! (Pointing.)

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: They're my second cousins!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: They've been here for years, and heard all the travelers talk. Surely they know the way to the Metal Kingdom.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Ask them, dear.

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 12.
CONCERTED NUMBER and FINALE.
PRINCIPALS and CHORUS.
---

lg.l: We have lost our way, so
Tell us how we may go
That the rains will bless you

div.stage: (Field Flowers come to life, rising to dance to the air. They make a low bow to POLY. as she finishes and then sing minuet chorus and dance about the stage, gradually forming themselves into a long lane diagonally across stage.)

lg.l: We consent to guide you and to grant your sweet request--
Would the way betide you if you wander to the West--
You'll be undertaking in the North so cold and drear--
South and East forsaking find the way lies only here.
The Metal Monarch you will find
But if to dangers you are blind,

div.stage: (They point along lane.

lg.l: Oh, now we know which way to go
These beauties show us clearly, so
We'll make a start and all depart
With courage smart and cheerful heart.
No more we dwell beneath a spell
These flowers tell us very well
The very thing we need to bring
Us to the ringing Metal King.

div.stage: MARCH SONG:

lg.l: The deed will crown us with renown--
We'll win a name and wealth and fame

div.stage: REFRAIN:

lg.l: We'll take the Metal Monarch, and
When we go marching to vict'ry!
The Flowers of the Field have told
Us just the road to take.
We'll march along this high-way, for
And when the Metal Monarch sees
If he's no fool, he'll know his rule

div.stage: REFRAIN:

lg.l: When we go marching to vict-ry!

div.stage: (During last verse, one by one the PRINCIPALS march up the lane, the OFFICERS waving swords and marking time. During the last Refrain, TIKTOK starts to march and runs down. SHAGGY and FILES run to his aid and set him on HANK, the mule, who kicks desperately, but finally carries TIKTOK off.)

PICTURE and
CURTAIN.
---
END OF ACT I.

div.head:
OZMA OF OZ
---
ACT II
---

body.tech:
OZMA.--II--66.
OZMA OF OZ.
---
SCENES IN
ACT II.
---
SCENE 1.--THE UNDERGROUND CAVERN OF THE METAL MONARCH.
SCENE 2.--A CANYON IN THE WILDERNESS. (In 2.
SCENE 3.--THE METAL FOREST.
---
----------
OZMA-----67.
OZMA OF OZ.
---
LIST OF CHARACTERS
Introduced in ACT II,
in addition to those in ACT I.
---
RUGGEDO: THE METAL MONARCH: who hates mankind because they
have robbed his kingdom of its
wealth.
FLASH: The Chief Imp: Subject of the Metal Monarch.
THE UGLY MAN: the Shaggy Man's beloved brother.
A MESSENGER: from the Rose Kingdom.
----------
CHORUSES:
METAL IMPS.
OFFICERS OF OOGABOO.
RED-ROSE CHORUS.
RAINBOW CHORUS.
FIREFLY CHORUS.
PIRATE FLEET.
----------
OZMA-----68.
OZMA OF OZ.
---
LIST OF MUSICAL NUMBERS
In Act II.
---
SCENE 1.
13.--BASS SONG and ANVIL CHORUS: "WORK LADS, WORK." RUGGEDO.
14.--DUET: "WHEN IN TROUBLE COME TO PAPA." RUGGEDO and POLYCHROME.
15.--MUSICAL BATTLE: (a) "FIGHT FOR OOGABOO." Officers of Oogaboo.
(b) Instrumental: "THE ATTACK."
(c) "BATTLE IMPS." Metal Imps.
16.--SONG and CHORUS: "A RAINBOW BRIDE." OZMA and PRINCIPALS.
SCENE 2.
17.--BALLAD: "MY LOVELY ROSE." Private FILES.
18.--DUET: "GIRLS ARE ALWAYS THE SAME." QUEEN ANN and OZMA.
19.--DUET: Topical Song: "CAPTAIN KIDD." TIKTOK and SHAGGY MAN.
20.--QUARTETTE: "LOVE WILL FIND A WAY." OZMA, FILES, RUGGEDO,
and ANN.
21.--Instrumental: STORM MUSIC: followed by a repetition of
"SUMMER RAIN."
SCENE 3.
22.--FIREFLY CHORUS: "FAIRIES OF LIGHT."
23.--DUET and CHORUS: "CALLAHAN." ANN and SHAGGY MAN.
24.--FINALE: Introducing popular selections from foregoing
songs and "THE MAGNET OF LOVE."
----------

div.head:
OZMA OF OZ.
ACT II.
---

MUSICAL NUMBER 13. BASS SONG and ANVIL CHORUS:
---
METAL MONARCH and METAL IMPS.
---
div.stage: SCENE 1.-- THE METAL MONARCH'S UNDERGROUND CAVERN.--This scene consists of an irregular rock setting, the rocks reaching nearly to the flies at background and at the wings. Perched upon these rocks in various places is the Chorus of METAL IMPS engaged in hammering metal upon anvils. These anvils are tuned so that the blows of the hammers play an anvil accompaniment to the OPENING CHORUS, and as each blow is struck the different anvils light up electronically, showing flashes of different colors. The face of the rock is everywhere set with colored jewels. These jewels are made by setting imitation cut-glass saucers, with the rounding side out, in the scenery, coloring them with transparent colors and placing an electric light behind each one. In the C. of the Cavern is the Metal Monarch's Rocky Throne, which also glistens with colored jewels. The METAL MONARCH is discovered seated upon this throne, puffing a long pipe and wearing his Magic Belt. This Belt is very broad and contains a row of electric buttons. When the METAL MONARCH wishes to perform any trick of magic, he pushes the proper button to accomplish his object, and at once a bell rings inside him to show that the magic has been performed. NOTE: THE CHORUS OF METAL IMPS is female.)

lg.l: Don't let me catch you lagging:
You've got a lot of things to do
Before you quit, I promise you,
There'll be no rest till you are through:

sp.speaker: METAL MON. and CHORUS OF IMPS:

lg.l: We're making spirit cabinets to fool the human race,
And muzzles for your mother-in-law to wear upon her face.
Our thirst-producers are so fine we cannot make enough;
Our corset-steels and high French heels to torture are the stuff.
Our orders we must promptly fill
Because our products fill the bill,
So heave your hammers with a will,

div.stage: (x indicates a stroke on anvil.)

lg.l: We will work be-cause we must,
x x x x x x x
Rain-ing might- y blows and just,
x x x x x x x
Lab-- or is the com- mon lot---
x x x x x x
We are har- dy, stur- dy, bold,
x x x x x x x
Beat- ing out the gleam- ing gold,
x x x x x x x
Strik- ing while the met- al's hot!
x x x x x x x
Each blow will tell its story!
We'll forge the shackles for mankind,
Whose lust for metal makes them blind;
Their fate is in our net entwined,
I'm known to be a wicked king, and foe to human kind,
No one so nobly wicked in the universe you'll find.
From love and sentiment I turn, and strive for hate alone;
And yet my conscience troubles me, so wicked have I grown.
Let your anvils sing the song
Of all your staunch and mighty throng!
The profits all to me belong,

div.stage:
(REPEAT ANVIL CHORUS AS BEFORE.
---

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: Your Majesty, there's a great demand for love philters. Oughtn't we to manufacture some of them?

sp.speaker: RUGGEDO:
sp.p: Love! Love! What have we to do with love? Hate's the only thing we're able to turn out. Never mind the love philters--- make water-filters, if you like.

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: But love is very popular, just now, up on earth.

sp.speaker: RUGGEDO:
sp.p: I hate love!--but I wish I didn't. I abhor love--but I'd give a gold button if I understood the idiotic sentiment. That's one reason I hate mortals. They can love, and I can't. So I hate 'em---I hate everybody!

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: And everybody hates you.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: What's that? Of course they hate me. Why shouldn't they?
sp.stage: (Scene lightens and variegated rainbow hues appear CHORUS of IMPS drop hammers and hide among rocks. RUGGEDO rises.)
sp.p: Hello, what's up now; or rather down? There can't be a rainbow underground! Im-possible!

div.stage: (ENTER: IMPS escorting POLYCHROME and BETSY.

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: It's the Rainbow's daughter, Your Majesty and a mortal maiden.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: (Sternly) What are you doing here?

sp.speaker: POLYCHORME:
sp.p: Are we not welcome, Ruggedo?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: No; you're both too pretty. I hate pretty girls.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Why, you old bear! If I once got my fingers in your whiskers I'd tear 'em out by the roots!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: You haven't any pull in this Kingdom, so be silent!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I won't. No man shall ever order me 'round; that's flat!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: On the square?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Don't anger the Metal Monarch, dear.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Why, he's always so angry.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: You're right, I am. I hate everybody and everybody hates me.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Oh, go out in the garden and eat wolly ones.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Wow! (Comes down from throne.) What do you want here?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I'm looking around to see,

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: This is no sea-cavern. (Gazing rapturously at POLYCHROME.Ah, if only I could love!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Can't you---if you try?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I don't know. I've never tried. I don't know how to try! Ihate all mortals because they rob my kingdom of its gold and precious metals. If they keep on digging they'll bankrupt me!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: But I'm not a mortal.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: (Surprised) No?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I'm the daughter of the Rainbow. But this mortal (Pointing to BETSY) is my friend.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Then I'll submit to her presence here, for your sake, little rainbow. Here, Flash! (To Chief Imp) Take this crazy mortal to the Royal Storehouse, and show her all the curious things we manufacture. Keep her busy for awhile--understand?

div.stage: (FLASH bows.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I understand, too. You want to get me away, so you can make love to Polly.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: (Furious) Hammer and tongs! This to me! Away with her, Flash!

div.stage: (Imp leads BETSY out.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Isn't your temper a little too violent?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: May be. You see, my dear---

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Your dear?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Hem! Of course. You see, my pretty rainbow, I can't hate everybody and keep my temper at the same time. Im-possible!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: But why hate everybody? You said you thought you could love me. Don't you think you could make an exception in my case?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Perhaps; if I knew how to love. Do you know, if I once gotstarted I believe I could love frantically--furiously--distractedly! It's all in knowing how, I suppose. Can't you give me a lesson, little rainbow? What are the "three R's" of love?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Recognition, recreation and recovery.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: And what is the geography of love?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: It's bounded on the North by Flirtation; on the East by Fascination; on the South by Revelation; and on the West by----

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Well?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Separation.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Oh, I see. You get a glance, you have a dance, then lookaskance and take a chance.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Exactly.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: (Bashfully coming nearer) Where do the kisses and hugs come in?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: What are kisses and hugs?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Don't know. How should I know? But I've heard 'em mentioned.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p:
I imagine you know more than I can teach you, Ruggedo. Perhaps
there are such things as kisses-- I'm not very wise--

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: (Tenderly) Well, I once came from Missouri, my dear.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: On the Rainbow love means happiness, a merry heart and contentment. When I lived there I loved only my father, and went to him in all my troubles.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Is that one of the privileges of love?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I think so.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Wehn in trouble come to papa, eh?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Yes; that's the idea.

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 14. DUET: RUGGEDO and POLYCHROME.
---
OZMA-----76.
"WHEN IN TROUBLE COME TO PAPA."
---

lg.l: There's a friend that never fails you,
If your tailor gown doesn't fit you,
If your rivals all outwit you,
If the handosme chaps forget you,
When in trouble come to papa!
If you are an old man's darling
Take your troubles all to papa--

div.stage: (DANCE.

lg.l: Papa never dares to bore you,
But declares he just adores you;
All he asks is smiles and kisses
When in trouble come to papa--
If you are an old man's darling
If you find you're out of money
Take your troubles all to papa--

div.stage: (DANCE.)
(They EXIT.
(ENTER: SHAGGY MAN, ANN and Army of Oogaboo. TIKTOK is the private, sitll riding the mule, HANK.)

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Halt!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: (Riding mule around in a circle) I can't. I have-n't an-yhalt-er. The beast won't stop.

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Halt!

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw! (Mule stops suddenly and TIKTOK tumbles off in a heap. They help him up.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks! The cav-al-ry is dis-mount-ed!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Where's Ozma? And where is Ex-private Files?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Lost!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Humbug!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: They seemed lost--in mushy conversation. Anyhow, they're so busy they couldn't hurry.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: They'll soon be here. Love is a gr-r-r-r-r---(Waves arms wildly)

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: (Sarcastically) Oh, wind him up, so we can find out what love is.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Where's the key?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: It's hanging on his back. (SHAGGY winds TIKTOK.) TIKTOK Ma-ny thanks!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Now, old fellow, the Queen wants to know what love is.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: That's not a queen lead. She'll ne-ver find out.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: I know already. I love--(throws herself at SHAGGY and clings to him)--but thee!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Help, somebody! Help! (HANK prances up and kicks at ANN, who dodges around SHAGGY, still clinging to his clothing. Unhand me, madam!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Never, my precious one! You made me love you, and I mean tohang on to my love like grim death!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: But this is too much, and then some. Why don't you love me as the others do? Calmly--from a distance.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: When I love, I love irresistibly--stickitively!
sp.stage: (She grabs him around neck. He pushes her away and hides behind mule.)
sp.p: You can't escape me, bewitching one. I'll have thee yet!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You pretty near halved me that time. Great Scott and Little Cupids! What shall I do?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: There's many a slip 'twixt the lip and the hic!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: You're wrong. It's----

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I'm right ac-cord-ing to my ma-chin-er-y.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Then you slipped a cog-wheel.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Don't blame me---blame the -z-z-z-z-z- pat-en-tee.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Can't your clockwork help me escape this love-sick amazon? What's the matter with her, anyhow?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: It's the Love Magnet. You worked the charm once too often.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're right, I believe I have.
sp.stage: (He stands a little back of TIKTOK, takes out the Love Magnet, kisses it, and hands it on a hook on TIKTOK's back, without the Clockwork man seeing him.)
sp.p: Now, my energetic Queen, I'm free!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Beautiful Tiktok! Exquisite creature! I love but thee!
sp.stage: (Throws herself upon TIKTOK, who nearly tumbles over. The OFFICERS catch and support him.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Wait--what--what's the joke?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: I love you, my armored cruiser! You have the Love Magnet.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: (Turning around) Where? Where is it?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: On your back---out of reach!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Dost thou return my love, Tiktok?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I have a chilled-steel ad-mir-a-tion and a cop-per bot-tomedres-pect for you. All my thoughts are riv-et-ted on-----

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: (Joyfully) On me!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: On my in-ter-ior. I can-not love ex-cept on tick.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Good for you, old chap! But look her, Ann, this is no time for love. Postpone your ecstasy. We've reached the Kingdom of the Metal Monarch at last, and our first business is to conquer him and set my brother free.

sp.speaker: GEN. FUSS:
sp.p: What we want is----

sp.speaker: ALL OFFICERS:
sp.p: Plunder!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You can't plunder till you've conquered.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Then let's conquer. But there's no one here to fight.

div.stage: (ENTER: BETSY, her arms full of golden ornaments, etc

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Don't worry. The place is full of Metal Imps. Look what I've found.

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Hurray! (They run toward her.)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Keep off! This jewelry store belongs to me. But there's a cave over there chock full of gold.

sp.speaker: GEN. FUSS:
sp.p: We'll conquer----

div.stage: (ENTER: OZMA and FILES.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: (Angrily) Oh, you're here at last, are you!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: You've guessed it, old lady.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Officers, arrest this deserter!

sp.speaker: GEN. FUSS:
sp.p: Private Tiktok, seize the deserter!

sp.speaker: TIKTOK:
sp.p: I re-fuse!

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Treason!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Never mind. My own true love shall do as he pleases. Officers,arrest the deserter!

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: (Not moving) It is not our duty!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Very well; refuse to obey me and I'll conquer the Metal Monarch myself, and keep all the plunder.

div.stage: (OFFICERS run and seize FILES.

sp.speaker: GEN. FUSS:
sp.p: What shall we do with him?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Take him away, blockhead--to the blasted hopes factory!

sp.speaker: CAPT. YOUNG:
sp.p: Where is it?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Anywhere, away from Ozma.

div.stage: (OFFICERS lead FILES awy.)
(ENTER: POLYCHROME and RUGGEDO.

sp.speaker: RUGGEDO:
sp.p: Clash and clatter! What's the meaning of this invasion?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: We've come here to conquer you. I'm Queen Ann of Oogaboo-- (ENTER: Officers.)--and this is my invincible army!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: We've come to release my brother, whom you captured in our Colorado mine.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: The Ugly Man! Im-possible! Ha! ha! How absurd! The wholething's absurd. Away with you--vacate at once, or I'll make you all my slaves!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Sir, I declare war upon you and your whole kingdom.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Very well, have your own way!

div.stage: (He yawns, goes to his throne, and lights his pipe.)

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 15. MUSICAL BATTLE: (a
"FIGHT FOR OOGABOO."
QUEEN ANN and ARMY of OOGABOO.

lg.l: Pitch in and do your duty:
Teach the Metal King who's who
Stike to win both fame and gold--
You will fright 'em when you fight 'em,
Swing your swords and bravely smite 'em,
You will conquer if you do,
We are the Army of Oogaboo--
We are on this conquest bent,
If we win we are are content,
So look out when we all about:

div.stage: (They wave swords.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Wait a minute, till I summon my army!
sp.stage: (He pushes a button on his Magic Belt. A bell rings and red glare suffuces stage.)
sp.p: Ah, I pushed the wrong button. That's the signal to light the furnaces. But never find.
sp.stage: (Pushes another button. Bell rings and crash of metal heard.
sp.p: Another mistake! The tin mine has caved in. Here, Flash!
Which button summons my army?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Oh, hurry up. We want to fight!

sp.speaker: TIK:
