sp.p: I have-n't an-y weap-ons.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Never mind. Use your fists.

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: (To Metal Monarch.) The North-east button summons your Majesty's army.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Im-possible!

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: I'm sure I'm right.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Then go ahead, and push it.
sp.stage: (FLASH pushes button and a bell rings.THE METAL IMPS appear in different parts of the rocks, bearing great golden shields, which almost hide their forms, and zig-zag swords tipped with red electric lamps. The scene darkens at back: the center, where the Army and Principals stand, still being lighted.
sp.p: Now I'm ready, whenever you are.

sp.speaker: GENERAL:
sp.p: Attention!

sp.speaker: COLONELS:
sp.p: Advance-----

sp.speaker: MAJORS:
sp.p: -----double-quicked-----

sp.speaker: CAPTAINS:
sp.p: -----March!

div.stage: (Shakey music. (b) TIKTOK walks forward a few steps then suddenly stops.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Wind-me-up-wind-me-up-wind-me-up-wind----

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Quick! Polly! (POLY. runs forward and winds him.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks!

sp.speaker: GEN. FUSS:
sp.p: Summon the Metal Monarch to surrender!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Sir, I sum-mon you to sur-red-ge-doo-bug-a-rug-a-dug-boo-dle-----

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Now his thoughts have run down!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Quick, Polly! (POLYCHROME winds him up.)

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Tiktok, you're a bum soldier. Hurry up and conquer.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I'm try-ing to. If I on-ly had a ---- (Stops short and wavesarms.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Tiktok, you're a sad mistake. I can buy a better man of Ingersoll for a dollar, with a year's guarantee.

div.stage: (POLY. is winding TIKTOK.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I have-n't an-y luck. Some-bod-y stole my Bil-li-ken.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Are you afraid?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: No. If I'm captured, there's an es-cap-ment in my -z-z-z-z-zclock-works.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Then for goodness sake, get busy and do something.

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Let Hank be the army. He can win, can't you, Hank?

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

div.stage: (SHAGGY and BETSY put TIKTOK on mule's back. HANK advances toward METAL MONARCH'S THRONE and gives a kick. TIKTOK tumbles off and mule stumbles on him. They roll upon stage together.)

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Enough! You've had your chance to fight, and now it's my turn.
Soldiers of the Metal Monarch---advance and capture these invaders!

div.stage: MUS. No. 15 (c). "BATTLE IMPS." METAL IMPS. The Army of METAL IMPS advances, forms ranks, and counter-marches on stage. The scene darkens to allow their flaming swords to be effective.)

lg.l: We are imps at merry fighting,
We are imps in war delighting:
We are imps because we serve an impish master!
We will flash our weapons gladly
We will dash to battle madly
We will overwhelm our foemen with disaster.
We march along with jest and song
We love to see the enemy
For we may state we emulate
The warriors great of early date,
And if you want to meet your fate

div.stage: (During this song the Officers tremble with fear and try to hide behind each other. The QUEEN, in despair, seizes SHAGGY's arm and points off to where FILES was taken. SHAGGY nods and runs off. During following dialogue the music is softly played.)

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: You see mortals, it is useless to resist. To conquer my Imps im imp-ossible! You are defeated already, so I call on you to surrender.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Never!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Fah! What can you do?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: There's a power greater than your own--the power of Cupid.
sp.stage: (Takes Love Magnet from hook on TIKTOK's back and holds it up.))
sp.p: I command all your imps to love me!
sp.stage: (METAL IMPS all kneel before him and lower their swords
sp.p: You see, unfortunate monarch, you are defeated!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Impossible! There's one shot still left in this Magic Belt. All I have to do is press a button and every mortal present will become powerless.
sp.stage: (Touches button: bell rings. ANN, FILES, SHAGGY, BETSY, the OFFICERS and MULE all become motionless in their places. Music ceases.)

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Dear me; what is the matter with them?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Hello? So you're not a mortal, my pretty maid?

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: No, Your Majesty. I'm a Rose Princess. But what has happened to our friends?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: The neatest magic trick my wonderful magic belt can accomplish. It's a case of arrested animation. I've stopped their clocks, so to speak. They can't think, speak or move till I release 'em.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: You have-n't stop-ped my clock.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: No; you're not mortal. But you'll soon run down.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: (Slowly)I feel----sort-a----run down----------now.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: But tell me, Ruggedo. How can you release our friends, should you wish to?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: By pressing this last button on the left. (Pointing) See? Until I press this button your friends will be ornamental----- but not useful.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: How dreadful! And poor Files among them. Can't he recognize me?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Not a roo.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Poor fellow.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Your Majesty, this is cruel and unjust.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Im-possible! Consider my case, sweet Polychrome. For yearsthese mortals have been robbing my dominions of all its fold, and now they have the audacity to penetrate to my Royal Cavern. I hate 'em! I hate everybody--but you! --and I want revenge!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: But revenge is wicked!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Of course. I'm terribly wicked. Frightfully wicked! I'm sowicked I sometimes scare myself. But I want revenge for the theft of all my gold.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Be merciful! Forgive them!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Can't, my dear. I'm too wicked.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Must they stand there always?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: No; they'd be in the way. I'm thinking of reducing them in size, so I can put them on my mantel-piece for ornaments.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Listen, Ruggedo. I now where there is enough gold to repay you for all that the mortals have stolen.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: (Eagerly) Where? Where?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: At the end of the rainbow. Wouldn't you be satisfied with the pot of gold at the rainbow's end?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Yes, indeed! But I'm no rainbow chaser. I'm no chaser at all. Do I look like Apollinaris?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: But listen. I know exactly where to find this gold, for my father always drops the end of his rainbow upon the spot. If you'll release these mortals, I'll show you where the gold is.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I'll release them when I get the gold.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Not before?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Not a minute before. Tell me; when is the next rainstorm, mydear; and when will the next rainbow appear?

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Look, your Majesty! Look at the sky through the rocks yonder! (Points) Do you see the storm approaching?

div.stage: (RUGGEDO raises his head to look and OZMA touches the button at the left of his magic belt. A bell rings and all the mortals waken to life, HANK capering about as if glad to be free.)

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: (Furious) Hammer and tongs! What have you done, girl?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Caught you in your own trap, Ruggedo! Now Officers, obey your private, or you are lost. Form ranks! (OFFICERS fall in line Attention! (Officers draw swords.) Forward, double-quick--- march! (OFFICERS surround RUGGEDO and two of them seize his arms

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Hurrah!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Don't let him touch his belt buttons.

sp.speaker: RUGGEDO:
sp.p: So; I'm a prisoner, eh?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Right you are, sir!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: But you can't find my gold, because it's all hidden deep in theearth.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: We demand the release of my brother.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: The Ugly Man? Im-possible! Why, his face would stop a clock!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Then don't re-lease him. My clock stops too of-ten now!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Good people, this Metal Monarch is not so wicked as he seems. Let us compromise with him and be friends.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: How compromise?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: It is true that mortals have stolen a lot of gold from the Metal Monarch. So I will show him how to get back an equal amount of gold, from the pot at the rainbow's end--on certain conditions.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: State your conditions, my dear.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: First: you must release the Ugly Man, the Shaggy Man's brother.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Agreed!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Hurrah! (Dances gleefully)

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Then you must give these officers enough gold to pay their back salaries.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Im-possible!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Then you remain our prisoner.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Well----agreed!

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Hurrah! (Embrace each other and express extravagant joy.)

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: And the last condition, both you and Queen Ann must agree to---- you must march with all your armies to the Rose Kingdom and force Ozma's rebellious subjects to accept her as their Queen--- ---and Private Files as her Royal Consort.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Why so?

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Because this is a case of true love, and everyone is bound to assist true lovers.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Agreed!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Agreed! (FILES embraces OZMA.)

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Now, I've one condition to make myself. Polychrome must consentto marry me.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: I don't mind. I'd like to reform you. It's so interesting to reform a wicked husband. But I'll do it from my rainbow, and if I don't succeed there'll be no harm done.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I couldn't live on a rainbow.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: No; you'll stay down below and worship me from afar.

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 16: SONG AND CHORUS: OZMA and Principals.
(CHORUS of METAL IMPS and OFFICERS of OOGABOO

div.stage: PRELUDE:

lg.l: Love is too often like a rainbow--
Mortals view it's grace with rapture,
Hoping all it's charms to captue
So we struggle to attain it
Mighty few will ever gain it,
That love's golden promise meets us
Rainbow, rainbow, prythee tell me true--
Is my love as pretty as she seems beneath thy hue?
Stars and moon alike are cold--
Daylight is too frank and bold--
All the world is lovely 'neath the rainbow!

div.head:
---
"A RAINBOW BRIDE."
---

lg.l: If a youth adores a damsel,
Who beyond his reach is placed,
To him every smile is radiant,
Every glance a dart of flame,
Every blush is like a sunset;
She is a rainbow of bliss to him
While from afrar he worships his star---
Never a flaw in the gem he sees,
She is his joy and pride;
Queen of his heart, though far apart,

div.stage: (All repeat Refrain.)

lg.l: Woe to him if she draws nearer;
He will find her mortal clay.
Should he see her closer, clearer
All his dreams are rainbow tinted---

div.stage: (Refrain by OZMA, and repeated by ALL as after first verse.)

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: And now we'll march away to the Metal Forest.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Where is that?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: In another part of my kingdom. It is in the Metal Forest thatyour brother is imprisoned.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Can't we send for him?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: No. We must all go together, in order to release him.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: And on the way we will surely find the rainbow.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: And the pot of gold.

sp.speaker: OFFICERS:
sp.p: Hurray!

div.stage:
MUSICAL NUMBER: A repetition of the most catchy Chorus of the march numbers proceeding. The PRINCIPALS and CHORUS start to march off; the scene darkens and song continues to the end, when lights up, discover Change to SCENE 2.
---

div.head:
OZMA OF OZ.
---
ACT II.
---
SCENE 2.
___

div.stage:
ACT II.--SCENE 2.
A CANYON IN THE WILDERNESS.--Rocks tower in background, with a chasm indicated by ground piece. See Mr. Voegtlin's diagram.)Lb/> ---
(ENTER: FILES.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: (Despondently) Misfortune follows misfortune. My Rose Princess and I cannot have the assistance of the Army of Oogaboo and the Metal Imps until we've found the Metal Forest and liberated the Shaggy Man's brother. And the Metal Forest can't be found. Even the Metal Monarch, who rules it, has lost his way, because his Magic Belt refuses to work and open the underground passage which is the only road to the place. (Looks around) If only I could manage to cross this chasm I believe the Metal Forest would not be far distant. But the canyon is impassable, so I must curb my impatience until the time comes when I may claim my lovely Rose.

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 17. BALLAD: PRIVATE FILES.
"My Lovely Rose."

lg.l: I'll sing a song of love to thee,
In dreams thy dainty form I see
Thy smiles with joy my heart imbue
Thy tears are pearls of glistening dew,
To you forever I'll be true,
I love thine eyes so shy and pleading;
I love thy lips, their pouts unheeding;
I love thy cheeks where smiles are speeding
A wealth of love I bring to thee,
To know what thou art truly mine
Is like a draught of sparkling wine,
I love thy sighs, thy moods revealing;
I love thy arm around me stealing;
I love thy kiss, my ardor sealing!

div.stage: (EXIT: FILES.

(NOTE: It is suggested that a Chorus effect could be introduced with the refrain as follows: costumes so provided that the back oof each represents a section of a red rose, extending from the head-dress, with stiff leaves projecting below the hips. The girls are arranged in a circle upon a low platform, their bodies inclined horizontally so that their heads meet in the center, their hands resting upon thier knees. In this position a perfect rose is displayed. The platform is drawn upon the stage by wires, when the girls stand upright, facing the audience, and dance to the refrain. Then they again form the rose upon the platform and are pulled off stage.)
(ENTER: QUEEN ANN and OZMA.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Then you promise to assist me, Queen Ann?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Yes, my dear; I've a weakness for lovers, because I've weaklyloved all my life.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Why weakly?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Because I'm still single. You might call it tri-weekly; butI'll have a man some day, if I have to chloroform him.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: You don't want Private Files, do you?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Now now. He's too rampant. I need a husband I can bull-doze. But Files is all right for you, dear, because you need a manager, seeing you couldn't rule the Rose Kingdom yourself. When we've found this wonderful Metal Forest, if we ever do, you shall have my army to assist you and Files in conquering your wild roses.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Oh, I'm so grateful!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Don't mention it. We giddy young things must stand together,for all the world's against us.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Is it?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Of course.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: If all the world is Private Files, I-I don't mind it.

sp.speaker: ANN:
OZMA:
sp.p: Oh, the girls of today aren't so strict--but they have a good time, just the same.

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 18. DUET: QUEEN ANN and OZMA.
"GIRLS ARE ALWAYS THE SAME."

lg.l: Maidens of old didn't gossip or scold,
Never talked nights when they put out the lights--
They'd say: "Oh, my dear, what a beautiful dress!"
That's what an old-fashioned girl would do,
What would a girl do now?
A girl of today wouldn't publicly say
If she suspected a gown resurrected
She'd smile--we'd all know the rest.
If a hat's out of date, or isn't on straight
If you know beans, you know what that means--
That's what a girl would do now.
Ages may come and ages may go,
But girls will ever be the same;
If a girl didn't lie now and then, on the sly,
She wouldn't be worthy the name.
Maidens of old my mothers were told
Never beguiling a stranger by smiling,
Never, they'd swear, to flirt would they dare,
That's what an old-fashioned girl would do;
What would a girl do now?
Girls of today have a more demure way
Frequently dine upon partridge and wine,
Ev'ry sweet lass is saving of gas,
If asked to the play: "I'm game!" she will say--
That's what a girl would do now.
Ages may come and ages may go,
But maids will be ever the same;
Any girl with a chance will step high and prance
Or she wouldn't be worthy the name.
Maidens of old were modest--not bold--
Men who were busted the girls never trusted,
Told 'em they wouldn't and couldn't for true
That's what an old-fashioned girl would do--
What would a girl do now?
Well, if her breast with love was oppress'd,
If she were fond and true,
Never a maid would e'er be afraid
To do what she ought to do.
Money won't weigh in the same scale, they say,
With love, and I guess it's true;
No matter how poor, she'd have him for sure--
That's what a real girl would do.
Ages may come and ages may go,
But maids will be ever the same;
If a girl wasn't foolish, and stubborn, and mulish,
She wouldn't be worthy the name.

div.stage: (They EXIT with Song.)
(ENTER: RUGGEDO, BETSY, SHAGGY MAN, TIKTOK, and HANK. They are all talking together and Ruggedo is angry.)

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Crash and clatter! Give me a chance to talk, won't you?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: That's all you're good for----talk!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Why don't you do something?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: You're a brass lob-ster!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Don't you know the way to your own Metal Forest?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Certainly. The Magic Belt always opens for me an underground passage. I just touch this button--so! (Touches button) and the passage opens!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Only it don't!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Something's gone wrong. Ever since Private Files loaned me the Love Magnet this blamed old belt refuses to work. I can touch every dod-gasted button on it--and nothing happens!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: What did you want of the Love Magnet?
sp.stage:
(Points to the Magnet
which is stuck in RUGGEDO belt.)

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I want to use it on Polychrome. A rainbow bride in the skies won't suit me. I want her in a more handy location---see?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Poor Pol-ly!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: But what are we to do? Where's your old Metal Forest anyhow?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: It must be just across this chasm.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: That's sar-casm.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: How can we get to the forest? (ALL approach chasm.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Why, Bet-sy, fly! Or leap be-fore you look!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: That's wrong! You should say---

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I'm right ac-cord-ing to my ma-chin-er-y.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Oh, you make me tired!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Don't blame me, blame the -z-z-z-z-z-z-z-zpat-ten-tee!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Hank, old hoss, can't you get across?

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: He could kick him-self a-cross if he tried!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Try it, Hank! (HANK gives a kick and tumbles over edge. BETSY grabs him by the tail and with SHAGGY's assistance drags him back to safety.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: See here, Ruggy--you've got to get busy and do something!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: If you don't we'll dump you in-to the chasm.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Silence! You mess of rusty wheels!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Don't be so rough, Ruggedo--get a little metal polish! Try Putz- Pomade!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Let me think!
sp.stage: (Places hands over eyes and stands silent. BETSY steals the Love Magnet from the Belt.)
sp.p: Perhaps I can find a way across the gulf!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: If the rainbow would appear over the canyon we could bridge it.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: If you bridge it, I'll make it hearts. And that reminds me---
I've lost Polychrome.
Ah! there she is!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I've got it, boys! (Holds up Magnet.)

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Adorable Betsy! I love you!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Be-witch-ing Bet-sy, I am yours!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're not! Out of the way, cog-wheels!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Get out yourself, whiskers!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: She's mine!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: She's mine!

sp.speaker: HANK:
sp.p: Hee haw!
sp.stage: (Mule kicks at hem. Sends SHAGGY sprawling and TIKTOK tumbles in a heap. HANK kneels to BETSY, then stands upright, lays head on her shoulder, puts one hoof around her waist and in other ways makes comedy love to her.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Oh, Hank dear! I didn't need the Magnet to make you love me, did I?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Pick-me-up-pick-me-up-pick-me-up-pick---
sp.stage: (SHAGGY, who has risen, and BETSY, lift TIKTOK to his feet.)
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks! My love-ly rose!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Shut up! Ingensoll!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: She's mine!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: She's mine--ain't you, Betsy? (HANK advances threateningly and they retreat.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I'm my own, just now. Fight it out among yourselves, and if either of you win me, just send me a wireless!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Less what?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Less I regret, I'll say it yet---

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: You're wrong Tiktok. You should say----

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I'm right ac-cord-ing to my ma-chin-er-y.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Your machinery's got ticks.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Don't blame me, blame the z-z-z-z-z-z-z-pat-en-tee!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Well--just let me know who wins, anyway.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: (To SHAGGY) Vil-lain!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Scoundrel!

div.stage: (ENTER: QUEEN ANN.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Here, here! What's the trouble?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: He wants my dar-ling Bet-sy!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: She's mine, and old Clockwork can't have her!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Two of you after one girl, eh? Well, see here: I'll take either of you, and that'll settle the whole difficulty. Which gets me? Speak quick, or I may change my mind.
No hurry, boys!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: She's too mod-est to change her mind in pub-lic!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I'm going to find some way to cross this ditch. Come on, Ann, there's nothing doing in the love line here.

div.stage: (EXIT: BETSY, ANN and HANK.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: There goes my sweetheart!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: She's mine. Stop your kid-ding!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I can't. I'm Captain Kidd!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Then go to sleep and you'll be kid-napped.

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 19. DUET: Topical Song.: SHAGGY MAN and TIKTOK.
With PIRATE FLEET CHORUS.
"CAPTAIN KIDD."

lg.l: When Captain Kidd was but a lad
He wouldn't mind ma at all,
On Sunday he played tag and ball,
The other boys he'd fight and maul
What made you act so bad?

div.stage: (Dance.)

lg.l: When Captain Kidd was but a youth
He headed for the Spanish Main
And many sheckles did he gain
And slaughtered men till they were slain
And much we fear a buccanneer

div.stage: (DANCE.

(ENTER: CHORUS with papier-mache ships around waist, legs concealed by sea-cloth, as indicated. Upper part dressed as Pirates, with fierce whiskers, swords and pistols. During Chorus and Dance they) discharge some of the guns and some ships are wrecked.)

lg.l: When Captain Kidd became a man
He drove his countless victims daft
If Standard Oil was in your toil
You'd bust the trust for true!

div.stage: (DANCE.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I'm away! Here comes the Queen! Run, Tiktok, or the antique'll get you.

div.stage: (EXITS.)
(TIKTOK starts to follow but suddenly pauses in comic position.
(ENTER: ANN.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Wind-me-up-wind-me-up-wind-me-up-wind-----

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: I'll wind you under one condition.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Wind me up under the arm. It's my condition that's worrying me,not yours!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Well, my condition's good.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: What is it?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: That you marry me.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: It wouldn't be right! It wouldn't be le-gal!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Why not?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I'm on-ly a ma-chine.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: I've noticed these machine marriages are as good as any.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Well, wind me up and I'll mar-ry you in the spring!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: All right! (Winds up TIKTOK) Your spring-time seems to come very often.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: When the spring time comes, gentle, ban-an-na---

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: That's wrong!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: It's right ac-cord-ing to my ma-chin-er-y.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Oh, get out!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I will, now I'm wound. (Marching off stage) When I'm tight, I'm all right. A-dieu, fair Queen!

div.stage: (EXIT: TIKTOK.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: So that's settled at last! I'm to be a bride! He says he'll marry me in the spring!
I wonder what spring he means? If it's a clock-spring I'll pound the deceiver into pin-heads!

div.stage: (Looks off after TIKTOK.
(ENTER: OZMA and FILES.)

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Don't be downcast, dear one. Every cloud has a silver lining.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: But we can't go to my own kingdom until we've found the Metal Forest, and this place is so cold and cheerless that not a flower can live here. Sweetheart, will you see your rose wither away and die in this dreary canyon?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: No, indeed. Be brave a little longer, my darling, and lovewill find a way.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: (Approaching them.) Quite right, Private. Love has found away with me. Congratulate me, Ozma; I'm engaged.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Engaged? Oh, I'm so glad, Ann!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: SO am I. Who's the lucky man, Your Majesty?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: (Bashfully) Mr. Tiktok!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: What! Old scrap-iron?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Didn't you say love would find a way?

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: He did, dear.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Well, Tiktok has had his weigh and he's worth his weight in gold.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Gold!--gold! Who's talking of gold? Want to rob me again, youmortals---eh?

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Oh, no, Ruggedo. All we want is to find the Metal Forest, and Private Files thinks Love will find a way.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Im-possible!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: You don't know the magic of love, Ruggedo.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Perhaps not; but I admit this love is a curious thing, and Inotice that mortals consider it a remedy for all ills. Perhaps it's more powerful than a Magic Belt.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Especially if the magic won't work!

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 20. QUARTETTE: OZMA, FILES, RUGGEDO, ANN.
"LOVE WILL FIND A WAY."

lg.l: Or weep or wail or tear his hair--
He simply winked his left-hand eye
And kissed his charming Thisbe though
A hole out in the wall.
You can't keep man and maid apart
If love is reigning in each heart,
No loving pair need e'er despair
For love will find a way.
Young Romeo, as well we know,
He found a lattice light and strong
And when he'd get to Juliet
A girl who has a chaperone
Is not restrained from flirting some
She send the staid duenna off
Though papa kicks a lover down
The girl will never mind at all
However hard the chap may fall--
And meet him in the park--
So let us hope they'll soon elope

div.stage: (They EXIT with song.
(ENTER: TIKTOK and SHAGGY MAN.)

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I say she's mine!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're wrong, she's mine!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ask her!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: She won't say.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: My beaut-i-ful Bet-sy!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: My captivating Betsy!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Stop it!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I won't! You'll soon run down, old chap, and then you'll be out of the game.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Heart-less ri-val!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Tell you what I'll do, Tiktok--I'll fight for the girl!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: All right. A du-el!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: And the one that loses, loses Betsy!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks! Wind me up and I'll pound you into mince-meat.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You must wear gloves. Brass knuckles are barred.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I'll ne-ver dis-guise my fists.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're a knocker.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: You're a-fraid.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: What! Of a junk-heap!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I dare you!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Look out, then!

div.stage: (Here follows a specialty scene and humorous prize-fight. Behind the prize-fight I'd like to drop a canvas painted with figures of spectators -- automatically rolling their eyes, opening their mouths and clapping thier hands. All stiff and worked by wires. The suggestion is up to Mr. Voegtlin...During this scene SHAGGY pounds TIKTOK and hurts his own fists more than he does the Clockwork Man. TIKTOK lands one blow, after many efforts, which doubles up the SHAGGY MAN, who returns to the fight dancing around at a safe distance. He pauses for breath.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You're the toughest proposition I ever tackled.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: I'm a thrash-ing ma-chine.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: You won't thrash me. I'll punch that button on your face that is marked: "Don't Touch!"

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: If you do you'll ru-in me!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Exactly what I want. I'll teach you to make love to my girl.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: She isn't yours, she's mine!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: That's the point we're trying to settle. Are you ready? Then come on!
sp.stage: (The fight is renewed, SHAGGY trying to reach the button on TIKTOK's forehead. At last he succeeds, there is an effect (by Mr. Voegtlin) by means of which TIKTOK is apparently blown to pieces and his machinery strewn all over the place.)

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks! Well, I awow! (Imitating TIKTOK)
Don't blame me, blame the-z-z-z-z-z-z-pat-en-tee! He's a junk heap now, for sure!

div.stage: (ENTER: OZMA, FILES, ANN, BETSY, RUGGEDO, and HANK.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: What's the matter?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Wish I knew.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: What's all this rubbish?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: It's Tiktok! Poor fellow! He exploded.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Oh dear! I'm so sorry! I was very fond of Tiktok.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: He's a total wreck now. But he's better off than we are, forhe's passed on and we're still here. Seems like we'll never cross the canyon.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Alas! must we all perish is this dismal place?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Be brave, my sweet Rose!

div.stage: (ENTER: POLYCHROME, hastily.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Quick, friends---quick! a storm is coming!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Let 'er come----we can't help it.

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: But it will be followed by the rainbow.

sp.speaker: ALL:
sp.p: (Wonderingly) The Rainbow!

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Yes; it will span the canyon, and if you are quick you can cross on it before it lifts.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: We'll try it, Polly, dear!

div.stage: (Stage darkens.

div.head: MUSICAL NUMBER 21. STORM MUSIC. and effects, followed by the appearance of the Rainbow, and repetition of the "SUMMER RAINSTORM."

sp.speaker: POLY:
sp.p: Help us, dear father!

div.stage: (This is a small effect, intended merely to show the audience by what means the characters are to enter the Metal Forest.)

PICTURE: and
QUICK CHANGE TO
SCENE 3.
---

div.head:
OZMA OF OZ.
---
ACT II.
---
SCENE 3.
---
div.stage:
ACT II.--SCENE 3.
---

THE METAL FOREST.--In this scene, which is an original conception by Arthur Voegtlin, the trees are all made of various metals, silver predominating. The tracery of the branches and leaves under the proposed lighting device, will lead a scene of sensational novelty and beauty. The CURTAIN RISES in darkness, and the company is provided with tiny lamps with which they run about, giving the effect of fire-flies during the following: )

div.head: MUSICAL NUMBER 22. "FIRE-FLY CHORUS."

lg.l: Swift through the gloom comes thy dazzling gleam
Cleaving the darkness with luminous beam;
Through field and forest so dark,
Though are out for a lark,
Fairies so gay, show us the way,
Hither and thither your way lies;
Shine when the stars are absent and shy,
Shine when the clouds are veiling the sky;
All through the twilight so drear,
Sentries of night, show us your light

div.stage: Dawn breaks.-- Various colors must be shown, beginning at dark blue, changing to red, thence yellow and finally through blending tints to white. The CHORUS has disappeared, and the music of the Fire-fly song is softly played until the scene is fully revealed in all its beauty.)
(ENTER: RUGGEDO and METAL IMPS, headed by FLASH.

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: Your Majesty seems worried!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I am. I've lost the precious Love Magnet.

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: Never mind. You were happy before you ever heard of it.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Not having seen Polychrome, and having once possessed the LoveMagnet, I shall never be happy again without the girl or the charm to win her.

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: Can't we make another?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Im-possible! It's metal, to be sure, but the God of love, Cupid,breathed upon it, which accounts for its magical power of attraction. But I'll have my sweet Polychrome--if I have to follow her to the rainbow!

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: And you! The terrible Metal Monarch, have been conquered bylove! You have even become friends with these absurd mortals.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Because they're going to restore the gold that has been stolenfrom me. The mortals are not so bad, Flash, once you come to know them, and they serve to amuse me!

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: Do you intend to release the Ugly Man?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Yes; he's imprisoned in this forest. He's of no use to me becausehe's too lazy to work. Let the Shaggy Man have his ugly brother, if he wants him. But here come the mortals!

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: Yes; they all crossed the gulch on the rainbow!

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: What a beautiful forest, Ruggedo.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Yes, it has amused us for many years in the making.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: It must be worth a lot of money.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I don't care for money. All I love to possess is the metalitself. But listen, mortals; I'll give the most precious tree in this forest for the Love Magnet.

sp.speaker: ALL:
sp.p: The Love Magnet!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Yes. I must regain it in order to secure Polychrome's love.It is at present lost, strayed or stolen.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: I wish I had it. You would be welcome to it, Ruggedo.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: If I had it I'd give it for half of one of your splendid trees.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Cheer up, Ruggedo. You may win Polly without the Love Magnet.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I'm afraid not. I'm a rough fellow, hard as my own metal.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: I'm sure you have a heart of gold.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Brass, most likely!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Hammer and tongs, woman! This to me!
sp.stage: (ENTER: BETSY on HANK. She is carrying a bag of some material which jingles when she moves.)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Storming again, Ruggedo? Your temper needs pressing with a flat-iron. It's got too many crimps in it.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I've lost the Love Magnet.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Oh, you have, have you?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Yes, and I'd give half my kingdom to get it back. What haveyou in that bag?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: It's--it's--the remains of my dear defunct Tiktok. I picked him up piece by piece.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: What a peaceful occupation.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Did you love the Clockwork Man, Betsy?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Yes, dear! Now, when he's beyond repair, I've discovered how nice he was. If you could see his works, Ozma, you'd know he was a clean, simple man of many excellent parts.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: He must have been.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: And if he did run down once in awhile----

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: Twice in awhile, sometimes!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Well, it was nobody's business but his own. Oh, dear Tiktok!
How much I'd give to be able to wind you up again!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Did you save all the pieces?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Every one!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Then I might be able to put him together again. I know allabout metal men, being the Metal Monarch, and I remember that Tiktok was made in my own workshop by his inventors.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Oh, was he?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Yes. But he refused to obey my orders and so I threw him downa well.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: And we pulled him up again. Oh, Ruggedo, do put Tiktok together -----and I'll give you---a kiss, even if it gags me!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I don't want your kisses. All I want is the Love Magnet.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Well, I'll give you the Love Magnet, then.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: (Eagerly) Where is it, girl---where is it?

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Tiktok will tell you, the first words he says after he's put together again. (Opens bag) Here are the pieces, Ruggedo; the quicker you work, the sooner you'll get the Love Magnet.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Very good. It won't take long to do the job.
sp.stage: (Here follows an effect provided by Mr. Voegtlin by which RUGGEDO restores TIKTOK.)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Glory Hallelujah! Oh, Tiktok, I'm so glad!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Ma-ny thanks!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: I saved you, Tiktok! I gathered you up when you were scattered and dissipated, and never lost a single piece!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Then I'm yours from now on. I may wear out in time, but while I last I'm yours!

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: Here's your reward, Ruggedo--- the Love Magnet!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Good. Now, then, sweet Polychrome must be mine!

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: But where is she?

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: She hasn't been seen since we crossed on the rainbow.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I'll find her, never fear. And when I do the Love Magnet will win her heart.
sp.stage: (ENTER: SHAGGY MAN. He looks at TIKTOK and begins to tremble, showing excessive fear.)

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: What is the matter, Shaggy Man?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: A--a--ghost! Avaunt, thou spirit of the demolished Tiktok--- avaunt! I've-- g--g--got my fingers crossed! You--you--can't haunt me!

sp.speaker: TIKTOK:
sp.p: Down on your knees, de-struct-ive mor-tal!
Mar-row bones for you, old chap, or I'll explode a-gain and blow you to at-oms!
Now beg my par-don!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Better obey, Shaggy Man.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: If you don't, you're a goner!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I--I--I beg your g--g--ghostly pardon!

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Grant-ed. Now stand up and be-have your-self! (All laugh asSHAGGY rises.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: What! You're not a ghost!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Copper ghosts are "impossible!" Aren't they, Ruggedo?

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Bet-sy saved the pie-ces and the Met-al Mon-arch put meto-geth-er a-gain!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Then I'm not a murderer! Here, Ruggedo, take this.
The Royal Gardener gave them to me, and they're yours. Sorry, old boy, I haven't more to give you.
sp.stage: (BETSY, HANK and TIKTOK, retire back stage examining Metal Forest. OZMA and FILES are also walking together among trees.)

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Why did the Royal Gardener give you so much money?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: He loved me because I had the Love Magnet. I suppose that's why I'm giving the coins to you, Ruggedo, isn't it?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: True. I now possess the magic metal.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: And with it the love of all you meet.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Say, Shaggy, if I had the Love Magnet would you love me?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Sure, old relic; I couldn't help it!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Ruggedo, let me take the Magnet.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Don't you do it, Rug!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Why, it would be a fitting punishment for all the trouble youcaused me in putting Tiktok together. Will you give it back, Ann, whenever I demand it?

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Of course I will! Tiktok's lost to me, and I've got to havesome man, or I'll die an old maid!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Then take it---and I wish you joy! (Hands her Love Magnet andthen retires back stage.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Help! Help!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: (Holding up Magnet) You're caught, Shaggy. There's no escape!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Beautiful vision!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Ah, ha!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: I adore thee! Thou art the pride of my heart---

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: (Tittering) Tee, hee, hee!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: The light of my life-----

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Tee-hee-hee-hee!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: The comfort of my soul and the joy of my waking dreams! Be mine!

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: (Throws herself on him and clutches him tightly) I'll beyour gold-mine!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: And I'll be a second Callahan.

sp.speaker: ANN:
sp.p: Who was Callahan?

div.head:
MUSICAL NUMBER 23. DUET: SHAGGY MAN and ANN.
"CALLAHAN."

lg.l: There was a man named Callahan--
And he was called a proper man
By all who knew his wife!
She nagged him and she twitted him,
He carved her with a knife.
He was such a peaceful man
Sure he might have pounded her
But he had a better plan--

div.stage: (CHORUS repeats Refrain while ANN and SHAGGY--DANCE.)

lg.l: They asked him how the fight began.
The judge was a married man,
And so he put him in the can
His wife whose name was Mary Ann,
Was not cut up, you see,
The man who owned the moving van,
And they eloped, by Cupid doped,

div.stage: (CHORUS and DANCE.

lg.l: He served his time, did Callahan--
And then for Civil Service ran
He was forever on his feet
And twirled his club and walked his beat.
He was the grandest in the land
One day an awful row begun
He went to see the fun.
And there he found his Mar-y Ann
And being such a peaceful man,
And now he's quite a happy man--
For both his wife and Hanrahan
Are in the jug for life!
And that's the limit, it appears,
It was agin the law, you see,
To cause such roar and strife.
He is quite a happy man
And has no wife to fight.
He through for good with Mary Ann,
Who used to drive the moving van--

div.stage: (CHORUS and DANCE.)
(After Dance, the CHORUS EXITS and Principals come down stage.)

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: We congratulate you, Queen Ann!

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Me, too. Ann's a big gun in Oogaboo. I'll take her home, have her enameled and padded, and she won't be so bad to look at, after all.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: You might do worse.

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Show me how, and I'm game to do it. But where's my brother, Ruggy?

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I nearly forgot him. Flash!
Liberate the Ugly Man and command his presence here.
sp.stage: (ENTER: A MESSENGER from the ROSE KINGDOM.)
sp.p: Ha! Where do you come from, my man?

sp.speaker: MESSENGER:
sp.p: From the Rose Kingdom, Your Majesty. I am sent by the subjects of the Princess Ozma to invite her to return and rule over them.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Why do they ask this?

sp.speaker: MESS:
sp.p: They picked a Prince after you left, but he had so many thorns he led the roses a prickly life. So they planted him and now ask you to return.

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: (To OZMA) What will you do, my dear?

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: Here is my answer, Messenger. Return to the Roses and tell them I have found a better Kingdom to rule--the Kingdom of Love-- in which my own dear Private Files is the king!

sp.speaker: ALL:
sp.p: Bravo, Ozma!

div.stage: (MESSENGER bows and retires.
(ENTER: FLASH and UGLY MAN)

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Oh, my dearly-beloved, long lost brother! How happy I am to see that charming face again!

sp.speaker: UGLY MAN:
sp.p: Shut up, Shag, ye durned fool. Whatcher doin' here?

sp.speaker: SHAGGY:
sp.p: Ah, that kindly, gentle voice! Those tender, loving words!
We've come to save you, dear brother.

div.stage: (Tries to embrace him but UGLY kicks him in shins.
(During this scene between SHAGGY and UGLY, all Principals by their actions, etc., express horror at UGLY's unsightly countenance. Bus. between Mule and the Ugly Man.)

sp.speaker: FLASH:
sp.p: (To RUGGEDO) Your Majesty, Polychrome has returned to herRainbow. While I was out to release the Ugly Man I met a messenger from her. She had said you may worship her from a distance, but that she will never again return to the earth.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Woe--woe--woe is me! But I suspected it!

sp.speaker: FILES:
sp.p: That's too bad, Ruggedo.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Never mind. I'd no business to fool with love. I'll go back tomy workshop and forget the Rainbow girl. I'll exchange Cupid for cupidity.

sp.speaker: OZMA:
sp.p: We're sorry for you, Your Majesty!

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: Never mind. It's just my luck. Every one here seems happilymated but me.

sp.speaker: BETSY:
sp.p: And me! Tiktok says he'll be mine, but he can't love me because he's a machine.

sp.speaker: RUGG:
sp.p: I'll fix that. Give me the Love Magnet; Ann you don't need it now.
sp.stage: (ANN hands Love Magnet to RUGGEDO. He opens a trap in TIKTOK'S head and drops Magnet in. Jingling of metal is heard.

sp.speaker: TIK:
sp.p: Now I'm all right, Bet-sy, and I'll love you like any-thing. A man is known by his works, and I'll work for you a-lone.

div.head: MUSICAL NUMBER 24. FINALE:
div.stage: (Introducing "THE MAGNET OF LOVE" and other airs and concluding with one of the March Songs.)

PICTURE and
CURTAIN.
---
THE END.
